minn rules    allowable onpremises signs within a scenic area minn rules    spacing and location required for advertising devices for business areas of highways or roads minn rules   special sign types a service area canopy signs each edge of a service area canopy facing a street is permitted 25 square feet of sign area in addition to all other sign area permitted on the site such signage may be illuminated externally internally or backlit  but no other part of the face of the canopy shall be illuminated b awning or sun canopy no part of an awning or sun canopy may be less than eight feet or greater than 12 feet above grade any sign area on the awning if illuminated will be deducted from the permitted wall sign area the fabric or material used for the awning or canopy must be opaque and no internal illumination is permitted c design of freestanding signs in the highway commercial sign districts freestanding signs in the highway commercial sign districts may not be supported by poles or columns they must be monumenttype ground signs with the copy resting on and supported by a solid base of brick or rock faced block in a color similar to or complementary to the main structure on the site the material of the base must extend at least halfway up the sides of the sign copy 026 435083  9 1141998 temporary signs temporary signs including streamers and pennants are permitted for a total of 30 days per calendar year the area of the temporary signs may not exceed 50 percent of the maximum sign area permitted at the site per table one section 8233 0222 435071 3 6 7 9  10 1141998 state law reference definition of temporary sign minn rules   subp 60s  chart of permitted signs temporary minn rules  2h sign adjustments adjustment to the height area or location of a sign may be approved by the city council if the following criteria are met 1 there are site conditions which require a sign adjustment to allow the sign to be reasonably visible from a street immediately adjacent to the street  or 2 the sign adjustment will allow a sign of exceptional design or a style that will enhance the area or that is more consistent with the architecture and design of the site  and 3 the sign adjustment will not result in a sign that is inconsistent with the purpose of the zoning district in which the property is located 12  11 1141998 state law reference similar provisions sign variances minn rules   proposed sign districts secs 82388270  reserved article vi  moving of structures purpose the process of preparing structures and transporting them from one site to another via public streets and related necessary site activity can adversely affect the health safety and welfare of the city the intent of regulating the moving of buildings within the city is to minimize the adverse effects of such activity consistent with minn stats  22181  vi1 enforcement a this article will be enforced by the building official public works director the chief of police and other authorized agents b the property owner is responsible to maintain the property to current city standards failure to maintain the property will result in the city causing the work to be completed and all charges will be assessed to the property owner  vi8 appeals of decisions appeals of a decision made by the building official public works director or zoning administrator shall be made in accordance with section 26 pertaining to appeals of decision of the building official and zoning administrator in the city zoning ordinance  vi9 building and zoning code requirements buildings or structures including manufactured homes that have been previously used or occupied for any purpose and that are moved into or within the city must comply with the provisions of the city building code and zoning ordinance for new buildings or structures  vi2 permit required a person must not move or cause to be moved a building or structure including manufactured homes that have been previously used or occupied for any purpose into within or out of the city without first obtaining all necessary permits to do so  vi3 moving permit application a an application for a moving permit must be completed and filed with the city clerk b the moving permit application shall include among other inclusions the following 1 the legal description of the premises from which and to which the building is to be moved as prepared by a registered land surveyor 2 a certificate of survey from a registered land surveyor showing the location of the building on the destination lot and related lot improvements 3 a rendering showing for the destination lot the proposed a grade and elevation as it relates to adjacent lots  b elevation of the first floor  c drainage and fill requirements  and d location of all utilities 4 photos andor drawings for the destination lot showing a all sides of the building or structure  and b the proposed building locations 5 the highways streets and other property over which the building is proposed to be moved 6 the proposed moving date and hours 7 evidence that the building and lot from which it is to be removed are free from mortgages liens or other encumbrances and that all taxes utility bills and other charges against the lots from which and to which the building is to be moved are currently paid 8 evidence such as a bill of sale showing that the applicant is entitled to move the building 9 the permit fee specified in the citys fee schedule adopted by the city council and amended from time to time 10 as part of the permit fee a limited letter of credit bond or certified check from the property owner for a minimum of $500000 payable to the city to ensure that the streets are not damaged and that the structure is properly removed from the former property located on the proposed property and attached to the foundation and utilities in compliance with the permit building code and this article 11 the name address proof of state license issued by the state under minn stats  22181 and proof of insurance of the proposed building mover 12 the name address proof of state license and proof of insurance of the proposed contractors that are connecting andor disconnecting utility services on the origin and destination lots 13 any additional information requested by the city planner building official or public works director  vi4 permit issuance a the issued permit must specify the following 1 the permitted days hours route movement parking speed limit and vegetation removal for the proposed move 2 written notice from the building official that the building or structure meets the requirements of the city building code and zoning ordinance 3 any additional conditions imposed by the building official public works director city planner chief of police or school district principal b the issuance of a city permit does not relieve the obligation to obtain required permits from other governmental agencies and does not permit the use of private property except when written consent of the landowner has been received by the public works director c the building official may refuse to issue the moving permit if it finds that 1 the permit application is incomplete as required in section 8276 2 a permit requirement in section 8276 has not been met 3 the building is too large to move or that no routes are available to be used without endangering persons or property or seriously inconveniencing traffic in the city limited vegetation trimming or removal may be allowed in the permit 4 the proposed route includes use of private property and no written consent from the owner has been obtained 5 people or property in the city would be endangered by moving the building 6 the building is structurally unsafe or unfit for the purpose for which it is moved if the proposed location is within the city 7 the proposed building movers equipment is unsafe and persons and property may be endangered by its use 8 the proposed building mover has been shown to be unreliable and irresponsible in complying with city requirements 9 the building to be moved is not worth at least 50 percent of the cost of a similar new building 10 the building in the proposed location in the city would fail to comply with any provision of the zoning ordinance and proper assurances of future compliance have not been given 11 the building in the proposed location in the city would not conform to the general bulk density andor character of and the types of architecture in the surrounding neighborhood 12 the necessary permits from other governmental agencies have not been obtained  vi5 supplemental information a at least ten city business days before the actual move is to take place the applicant must submit to the building official and public works director all of the following supplemental information 1 the proposed moving date and hours 2 a copy of the proposed building movers state license and an insurance certificate showing that the mover has current insurance coverage required by state law 3 the identity of the motor vehicle and trailer to be used including the make model model year license number and vehicle identification number and evidence that the motor vehicle trailers and other equipment is in compliance with state and federal requirements for use on public highways 4 a signed statement from the applicant or a contractor agreeing to fence or secure the foundation at the original building location to install a silt fence to fill the foundation cavity with an approved fill to landscape the surface with perennial grass and to keep the area safe and clean in accordance with section 8279 if that location is within the city 5 a signed statement from the applicant or a contractor agreeing to properly abandon any wells fill any septic tanks andor properly disconnect all utilities in accordance with section 8279 if the original building location is within the city 6 a signed statement from the applicant or a contractor agreeing to connect the building to its new foundation in accordance with section 8279 7 existing water and sewer service must be terminated and all outstanding bills paid prior to the issuance of a permit b a permit for a building move is void if the additional information required in subsection a of this section is not provided in a timely manner as determined by the building official or public works director c in consultation with the chief of police principal of the school district and building official the public works director may deny the proposed moving date and hours if the move at that time would unreasonably interfere with the publics use of a street or highway or would otherwise adversely affect the public interest the public works director may also deny use of the proposed building mover if its equipment is not in compliance with federal and state requirements it does not have a current license or insurance as required by state law or it has previously been unreliable or irresponsible in complying with city requirements the director must notify the applicant in writing of a denial at least five city business days before the proposed moving date giving the reasons for denial the applicant may file a written appeal of this decision with the city clerk to be heard by the city council at its next available meeting unless the applicant selects a later date in writing  vi6 building moving conditions a a licensed building mover must comply with the following when moving buildings into within or out of the city the building mover must 1 move a building only in compliance with the permit conditions and only over the streets and other property designated for that use in the permit 2 obtain prior permission from the chief of police for any changes in the approved route or times for the move 3 notify the police department and school district at least four hours in advance of the proposed move 4 notify the public works director of all damage done to any property during the move within 24 hours after the damage has occurred 5 be responsible for all damage caused by the move and pay the cost to correct the damage or the value of the property lost because of the damage 6 remove all debris located on the origin and destination lots and along the public andor private land along the route within 48 hours of the completion of the move in accordance with section 201 7 comply with state and county requirements for oversized vehicles and loads 8 use only the motor vehicles and trailers identified in the supplemental information or obtain police department approval of any substitution before the move and provide written verification of this approval to the public works director before the structure is moved 9 when necessary erect and maintain barricades across the streets and other necessary traffic control devices during the entire time period of the move to protect the public from damage or injury because of the move 10 complete the move within 48 hours after either a the building crosses into the city if moved from a location outside the city  or b the building is raised from its original foundation if moved from a location within the city 11 pay the expense of employees or other individuals who are required and retained by the city to accompany or monitor the movement of the building for the purpose of ensuring compliance with the moving permit or protecting the public health safety or welfare 12 comply with all applicable state laws and local ordinances b a move is complete when the structure has been moved to the precise location shown on the approved certificate of survey and the equipment used to move the building has been removed c a building mover cannot transfer its obligations under subsection a of this section to the building owner or any other party except where the responsibility for damage is insured by a contract for liability insurance d within 120 days after the date of the permit issuance the building must be moved the building code requirements met as they apply to the structure at its new location and a certificate of occupancy for the building received if all requirements are met e a person must not cause or permit a structure that has been raised from a foundation and placed on supports to 1 remain at a location or locations in the city other than the new permanent location for longer than 48 hours  or 2 remain on any property without the written consent of the property owner f the applicant the landowner and the contractor hired to be responsible for the work must not leave rubbish or other materials at the site from which the building is moved or otherwise allow that site to remain in an unsafe unsanitary or unsightly condition g the applicant the landowner and the contractor hired to be responsible for a building foundation must not allow an open and unattended foundation to remain unsecured for more than a twohour period immediately after a building has been raised from the foundation foundations must be fenced or secured in some other manner to prevent uninvited access particularly by children to the open foundation h the applicant the landowner and the contractor hired to be responsible for a building foundation must not allow a foundation from which a building has been removed to remain open longer than seven days after the building was removed foundations must be removed and the cavity filled with previously approved earth materials to the original contours covered to a depth of four inches with the approved topsoil seeded with perennial grass previously used foundations and related materials may be used in the construction of a new building if approved by the building official i no later than the time required by subsection a of this section for filling the foundation the applicant the landowner or a contractor hired to be responsible must properly abandon any wells and fill any septic tanks remaining on the original site of the building if these will no longer be used on parcels within the city a statelicensed plumber must be retained to properly disconnect existing water and sewer services utility services will be required to be disconnected at the main lines unless otherwise approved by the building official any disturbances to the street or any improvement within the public rightofway must be repaired to a standard at least comparable to the previously existing condition within 48 hours of disconnect j the building must be connected to the foundation at its new location in accordance with the city building code within ten days after the move has been completed k variances from the provisions of this article may be granted by the public works director upon documentation of good cause l a failure to comply with a permit provision building code requirement or condition in this article will result in a forfeiture of the letter of credit bond or cash deposit the city may use the financial proceeds to complete unfinished work required by the permit the building code or this article or to pay for any damage caused by the move m no work will be permitted that violates applicable noise ordinance and regulations  vi7 businesses footnotes  1  cross reference alcoholic beverages ch 4  emergency management ch 2  state law reference authority to prevent or license and regulate amusements and amusement devices minn stats   subd 25 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning amusement device means any table or machine which may be used for any game or contest or amusement and for the use operation or playing of which money or any other consideration is charged either by insertion of a coin into such table or machine or in any other manner including such devices as pinball machines novelty machines skill machines pool or billiard machines foosball machines bowling machine or any other machine or device commonly known as and used as a game of skill amusement or play and for the use operation or playing of which a consideration is charged  however nothing in this section shall be construed to include within the definition of amusement device a coinoperated music box or what is commonly known as a jukebox operator means a person who keeps or allows to be kept amusement devices on premises owned by him or under his control where they may be played by members of the public legally upon such premises upon payment of the charge or consideration required to play such amusement devices 01 cross reference definitions generally  12 license required no person shall become an operator of any amusement device nor shall any person own operate maintain or keep for public use and play within the city any amusement device without first having applied for and received an operators license  except no such license shall be required for an amusement device kept in a private residence and not available for public play no such license shall be issued for any device or machine which constitutes a roulette wheel slot machine or any other device or machine commonly known to be and used for gambling purposes nor shall any person having obtained an operators license own operate maintain or keep for public use and play within the city any amusement device without first having such amusement device inspected and tagged and the appropriate fee paid to the city 02 state law reference definition of gambling device minn stats  60976 subd 4  with certain exceptions manufacturing selling offering for sale providing or setting up for the purpose of gambling a gambling device constitutes a gross misdemeanor minn stats  60976 subd 14 and 5 license application fees inspection and display a application for an operators license shall be made at the office of the city clerk upon forms to be provided by the city the application shall be accompanied by payment of a fee to be set from time to time by the city council per amusement device to be owned operated maintained or kept for public use on the applicants premises the application shall specify the number types and distinguishing characteristics of the amusement devices for which the applicant seeks an operators license and shall clearly identify the premises upon which such amusement devices shall be kept upon an operators license being granted each amusement device shall be inspected by such city employees or agents as the council may authorize and designate from time to time such inspector shall then attach a prenumbered or prelettered tag which the city shall supply to each amusement device found to comply with the provisions of this article in such a way that it can be readily seen and which tags shall remain so attached during the term of the license such inspector shall thereafter spot check the licensees devices and premises on a quarterly basis the operators license upon being granted shall be issued to the operator upon a form or certificate supplied by the city and shall be plainly displayed in the operators place of business all license fees shall be paid into the general fund of the city all operators licenses shall commence on september 1 of each year and terminate on august 31 of the subsequent year license fees shall be paid in advance b no operators license shall be transferable as to person or premises nor shall any tags be transferrable between or among amusement devices however the holder of a valid operators license may automatically receive additional license tags for replacement or newly acquired amusement devices on condition that the annual license fee is first paid and the replacement or newly acquired amusement devices have been inspected 03 granting suspension andor revocation of license the council shall grant or deny any application as provided in this article  and if granted the council may suspend or revoke such license for good cause shown upon notice and hearing 04 prohibited practices no person shall permit the operation of an amusement device for the purposes of making side bets or gambling in any form 05 state law reference making a bet constitutes a misdemeanor minn stats   subd 1 secs 10361070  reserved article iii  cigarettes and tobacco products footnotes  3  state law reference authority to license and regulate the retail sale of tobacco as defined in minn stats   subd 1 minn stats  46112 subd 1  minn stats  4611246118 do not preempt a local ordinance that provides for more restrictive regulation of tobacco sales minn stats  46119 division 1  generally purpose because the city recognizes that many persons under the age of 18 years purchase or otherwise obtain possess and use tobacco tobacco products and tobaccorelated devices and such sales possession and use are violations of both state and federal laws  and because studies which the city hereby accepts adopts and are on file at city hall have shown that most smokers begin smoking before they have reached the age of 18 years and that those persons who reach the age of 18 years without having started smoking are significantly less likely to begin smoking  and because smoking has been shown to be the cause of several serious health problems which subsequently place a financial burden on all levels of government  this article shall be intended to regulate the sale possession and use of tobacco tobacco products and tobaccorelated devices for the purpose of enforcing and furthering existing laws to protect minors against the serious effects associated with the illegal use of tobacco tobacco products and tobaccorelated devices and to further the official public policy of the state in regard to preventing young people from starting to smoke as stated in minn stats    1131997 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning cigarette means any roll for smoking made wholly or in part of tobacco the wrapper or cover of which is made of paper or another substance or material except tobacco state law reference definition of cigarette minn stats  297f01 subd 3 compliance checks means the system the city or other units of government use to investigate and ensure that those authorized to sell tobacco tobacco products and tobaccorelated devices are following and complying with the requirements of this article compliance checks shall involve the use of minors over the age of 15 years but under the age of 18 years as authorized by this article compliance checks shall also mean the use of minors over the age of 15 years but under the age of 18 years who attempt to purchase tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices for educational research and training purposes as authorized by state and federal laws state law reference compliance checks minn stats  46112 subd 5 loosies means the common term used to refer to a single or individually packaged cigarette minor means any natural person who has not yet reached the age of 18 years state law reference definition of minor minn stats   subd 2 insertion of money tokens or other form of payment directly into the machine by any person  1131997 cross reference definitions generally  12 secs 10731090  reserved division 2  licenses required no person shall sell or offer to sell any tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices without first having obtained a license to do so from the city intro  1131997 application an application for a license to sell tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices shall be made on a form provided by the city the application shall contain the full name of the applicant the applicants residential and business addresses and telephone numbers the name of the business for which the license is sought and any additional information the city deems necessary upon receipt of a completed application the city clerk shall forward the application to the council for action at its next regularly scheduled council meeting if the city clerk shall determine that an application is incomplete he shall return the application to the applicant with notice of the information necessary to make the application complete 1 1131997 action the council may either approve or deny a license under this division or it may delay action for such reasonable period of time as necessary to complete any investigation of the application or the applicant it deems necessary if the council shall approve the license the city clerk shall issue the license to the applicant if the council denies the license notice of the denial shall be given to the applicant along with notice of the applicants right to appeal the councils decision 2 1131997 term all licenses issued under this division shall be valid for one calendar year from the date of issue 3 1131997 revocation or suspension any license issued under this division may be revoked or suspended as provided in section 10101 4 1131997 transfers all licenses issued under this division shall be valid only on the premises for which the license was issued and only for the person to whom the license was issued no transfer of any license to another location or person shall be valid without the prior approval of the council 5 1131997 movable place of business no license shall be issued to a moveable place of business only fixed location businesses shall be eligible to be licensed under this division 6 1131997 display all licenses shall be posted and displayed in plain view of the general public on the licensed premises 7 1131997 renewals a the renewal of a license issued under this division shall be handled in the same manner as the original application the request for a renewal shall be made at least 30 days but no more than 60 days before the expiration of the current license b the issuance of a license under this division shall be considered a privilege and not an absolute right of the applicant and shall not entitle the holder to an automatic renewal of the license 8 1131997 state law reference authority to license and authority to establish a license fee for sales to recover administrative costs minn stats  46112 subd 1 basis for denial of license the following shall be grounds for denying the issuance or renewal of a license under this division  however except as may otherwise be provided by law the existence of any particular ground for denial does not mean that the city must deny the license if a license is mistakenly issued or renewed to a person it shall be revoked upon the discovery that the person was ineligible for the license under this division because 1 the applicant is under the age of 18 years 2 the applicant has been convicted within the past five years of any violation of a federal state or local law ordinance provision or other regulation relating to tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices 3 the applicant has had a license to sell tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices revoked or suspended on two or more occasions within the preceding 12 months of the date of application 4 the applicant fails to provide any information required on the application or provides false or misleading information 5 the applicant is prohibited by federal state or other local law ordinance or other regulation from holding such a license  1131997 secs 1010210120  reserved division 3  sales prohibited sales it shall be a violation of this article for any person to sell article 3 by means of selfservice methods whereby the customer does not need to make a verbal or written request to an employee of the licensed premises in order to receive the tobacco tobacco product or tobaccorelated device and whereby there is not a physical exchange of the tobacco tobacco product or tobaccorelated device between the licensee or the licensees employee and the customer 4 by means of loosies as defined in section 1072 5 containing ammonia or any compound of ammonia arsenic cadmium formaldehyde lead opium morphine jimson weed belladonna strychnos cocaine marijuana or other under the age of 18 is unlawful minn stats   subd 1a vending machines it shall be unlawful for any person licensed under this article to allow the sale of tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices by the means of a vending machine any retailer selling tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices on  shall comply with this section within 45 days this section does not apply to facilities that cannot be entered at any time by persons younger than 18 years of age  1131997 state law reference vending machine sales prohibited except in facilities from which persons under 18 years of age are excluded minn stats  46118 subd 2 selfservice sales it shall be unlawful for a licensee under this article to allow the sale of tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices by any means whereby the customer may have access to such items including but not limited to individually packaged or multipack units of tobacco or tobacco products without having to request the item from the licensee or the licensees employee and whereby there is not a physical exchange of the tobacco tobacco product or the tobaccorelated device between the licensee or his clerk and the customer all tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices shall either be stored behind a counter or other area not freely accessible to customers or in a case or other storage unit not left open and accessible to the general public any retailer selling tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices on  shall comply with this section within 45 days this section does not apply to retail stores which derive at least 90 percent of their revenue from tobacco and tobaccorelated products and which cannot be entered at any time by persons younger than 18 years of age  1131997 state law reference selfservice sales of single packages of cigarettes or smokeless tobacco are prohibited except in adultonly facilities minn stats  46118 subd 1 responsibility all licensees under this article shall be responsible for the actions of their employees in regard to the sale of tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices on the licensed premises  and the sale of such an item by an employee shall be considered a sale by the license holder nothing in this section shall be construed as prohibiting the city from also subjecting the clerk to whatever penalties are appropriate under this article state or federal law or other applicable law or regulation  1131997 state law reference administrative penalties apply to employees of licensees as well as to licensees minn stats  46112 subd 2 compliance checks and inspections all licensed premises shall be open to inspection by the city police or other authorized city official during regular business hours from time to time but at least once per year the city shall conduct compliance checks by engaging with the written consent of their parents or guardians minors over the age of 15 years but less than 18 years to enter the licensed premises to attempt to purchase tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices minors used for the purpose of compliance checks shall be supervised by city designated law enforcement officers or other designated city personnel minors used for compliance checks shall not be guilty of unlawful possession of tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices when such items are obtained as a part of the compliance check no minor used in compliance checks shall attempt to use a false identification misrepresenting the minors age  and all minors lawfully engaged in a compliance check shall answer all questions about the minors age asked by the licensee or his employee and shall produce any identification if any exists for which he is asked nothing in this section shall prohibit compliance checks authorized by state or federal laws for educational research or training purposes or required for the enforcement of a particular state or federal law  1131997 state law reference compliance checks minn stats  46112 subd 5 billboards billboards advertising any tobacco tobacco product or tobaccorelated device shall be governed by section 8191 et seq  1131997 secs 1012710150  reserved division 4  illegal acts specified unless otherwise provided the following acts shall be a violation of this article 1 illegal sales it shall be a violation of this article for any person to sell or otherwise provide any tobacco tobacco product or tobaccorelated device to any minor 2 illegal possession it shall be a violation of this article for any minor to have in his possession any tobacco tobacco product or tobaccorelated device this subsection shall not apply to minors lawfully involved in a compliance check state law reference selling tobacco to a minor is unlawful minn stats   subd 1a  furnishing tobacco or tobaccorelated devices to a minor is unlawful minn stats   subd 2 3 illegal use it shall be a violation of this article for any minor to smoke chew sniff or otherwise use any tobacco tobacco product or tobaccorelated device state law reference unlawful for a minor to possess smoke chew or otherwise ingest purchase or attempt to purchase tobacco or tobaccorelated devices minn stats   subd 3 4 illegal procurement it shall be a violation of this article for any minor to purchase or attempt to purchase or otherwise obtain any tobacco tobacco product or tobaccorelated device  and it shall be a violation of this article for any person to purchase or otherwise obtain such items on behalf of a minor it shall further be a violation for any person to coerce or attempt to coerce a minor to illegally purchase or otherwise obtain or use any tobacco tobacco product or tobaccorelated device this subsection shall not apply to minors lawfully involved in a compliance check 5 use of false identification it shall be a violation of this article for any minor to attempt to disguise his true age by the use of a false form of identification whether the identification is that of another person or one on which the age of the person has been modified or tampered with to represent an age older than the actual age of the person  1131997 state law reference it is an affirmative defense to the charge of selling tobacco to a person under age 18 that the licensee or individual making the sale relied in good faith upon proof of age minn stats  46112 subd 6 secs 1015210170  reserved division 5  enforcement violations a notice upon discovery of a suspected violation of this article the alleged violator shall be issued either personally or by mail a citation that sets forth the alleged violation and which shall inform the alleged violator of his right to be heard on the accusation b hearings if a person accused of violating this article so requests a hearing shall be scheduled the time and place of which shall be published and provided to the accused violator c hearing officer the city council shall serve as the hearing officer d decision if the hearing officer determines that a violation of this article did occur that decision along with the hearing officers reasons for finding a violation and the penalty to be imposed under section 10172 shall be recorded in writing a copy of which shall be provided to the accused violator likewise if the hearing officer finds that no violation occurred or finds grounds for not imposing any penalty such findings shall be recorded and a copy provided to the acquitted accused violator e appeals appeals of any decision made by the hearing officer shall be filed in the district court for the city f prosecution nothing in this section shall prohibit the city from seeking prosecution in addition to imposing administrative penalties for any alleged violation of this article  1131997 state law reference judicial review constitutes appeal from administrative hearing on illegal sale of tobacco minn stats  46112 subd 7 penalties a licensees any licensee found to have violated this article or whose employee shall have violated this article shall be charged an administrative fine pursuant to a penalty schedule determined from time to time by the city and published in a penalty schedule adopted by the city council at a regularly scheduled council meeting in addition after the second offense the license shall be suspended for not less than three days after the third offense the license shall be suspended for not less than seven days b other individuals individuals other than minors found to be in violation of this article shall be charged an administrative fine pursuant to a penalty schedule determined from time to time by the city and published in a penalty schedule adopted by the city council at a regularly scheduled council meeting c prosecution nothing in this section shall prohibit the city from seeking prosecution as a misdemeanor for any violation of this article  1131997 exceptions and defenses nothing in this article shall prevent the providing of tobacco tobacco products or tobaccorelated devices to a minor as part of a lawfully recognized religious spiritual or cultural ceremony it shall be an affirmative defense to the violation of this article for a person to have reasonably relied on proof of age as described by state law  1131997 state law reference administrative penalties minn stats  46112 subds 2 3 secs 1017410200  reserved article iv  gambling footnotes  4  state law reference authority to adopt more stringent regulation of lawful gambling including prohibition of lawful gambling minn stats   division 1  generally policy a statement of purpose it is the stated policy of the city that to the extent lawful regulated gambling is permitted within the city and the net profits and proceeds of gambling shall directly benefit the citizens of the city b gambling a privilege the city council finds that lawful gambling is a nuisanceprone activity and as such is subject to restrictive regulations the city council further finds and declares that the ability to conduct lawful gambling and participate in lawful gambling is a privilege rather than a right  142000 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning charitable means aid given to those in need a gift for public benevolent purposes gambling control division means the state agency that licenses and regulates gambling lawful gambling means the operation conduct or sale of bingo raffles paddlewheels tip boards and pull tabs state law reference lawful gambling minn stats ch 349 lawful purpose means any expenditure by or contribution to a 501k3 organization provided that the organization and expenditure or contribution are in conformity with standards prescribed by the gambling control board under minn stats   net profit means gross profit less reasonable sums actually expended for allowable expenses organization means a religious fraternal veterans or other nonprofit entity which has been in existence for at least three years has at least 15 active members and is not in existence solely for the purpose of conducting gambling state law reference definition of organization minn stats  34911 subd 28 premises permit means a permit caused by the state gambling control board for each premises where lawful gambling is to be conducted trade area means the city limits and the contiguous city of orono  142000 cross reference definitions generally  12 penalty any person fraternal veterans or other nonprofit organization or on the premises of an onsale liquor licensee of the city 2 all of the following requirements are met a the physical site for the organizations headquarters or the registered business office of the organization is located within the city or a city contiguous to the city for at least two years immediately preceding the application for a subp 2 distribution of proceeds a during any year that an eligible organization is licensed to conduct lawful gambling no less than 75 percent of its lawful purpose expenditures shall be for lawful purposes conducted or located within the city trade area the city trade area is defined as the city limits and the contiguous city of orono b during any year that an eligible organization is licensed to conduct lawful gambling such organization shall contribute ten percent of the net profit derived from lawful gambling within the city to a fund administered and regulated by the city without cost to such fund for disbursement by the city of the receipts for lawful purposes these ten percent contributions shall be made to the city at the same time of filing the monthly state gambling report and at no time shall the ten percent contribution be a negative number ie if the licensed operation loses money on operation in a given month the ten percent contribution shall be $000  142000 state law reference expenditure restrictions on use of gross profits from lawful gambling minn stats  34915 subd 1 reporting requirements a every organization licensed to conduct gambling in the city shall file with the city clerk copies of the monthly state gambling report and schedule c required to be filed with the state lawful gambling control board pursuant to minn stats ch 349 the records and reports shall be due at the same time they are due to the gambling control board the city shall file all state or federal reports necessary b every organization licensed to conduct gambling in the city shall file with the city clerk an annual summary report of lawful purpose expenditures of gambling profits no later than january 30 of each year c organizations conducting gambling activities in other communities as well as the city shall segregate the gross receipts expenses profits and expenditures of profits from the city operation d a semiannual report of the expenditures for lawful purpose gambling within the trade area shall be provided to the city clerk on or before july 2 and february 2 of each year  142000 secs 1022510360  reserved article v  junk footnotes  6  state law reference old or scrap ferrous or nonferrous material state law reference definition of junk minn stats   subd 2d junk business means the keeping conducting or maintaining of any building structure yard or place for keeping storing or piling in commercial quantities whether temporarily irregularly or continually or the buying and selling at retail or wholesale or dealing in any junk junk dealer means and includes any person engaged in the junk business state law reference definition of junk dealer minn stats   subd 2c  junkyard means an establishment place of business or place of storage or deposit which is maintained operated or used for storing keeping buying or selling junk or for the maintenance or operation of an automobile graveyard and shall include garbage dumps and sanitary fills not regulated by the state pollution control agency any of which are wholly or partly within onehalf mile of any rightofway of any state trunk highway including the interstate highways whether maintained in connection with another business or not where the waste body or discarded material stored is equal in bulk to five or more motor vehicles and which are to be resold for used parts or old commissioner of transportation plantings shall be used in connection with any fence or other nonnatural screening device plantings that will eventually achieve effective screening shall be effective state law reference requirements of screening of junkyards minn stats   subd 3a 01 cross reference definitions generally  12 secs 1036210380  reserved division 2  licenses required no junk dealer shall engage in the junk business within the city without first obtaining a license pursuant to this division 02 application every applicant for a license to engage in the junk business shall file with the city clerk a written application to be supplied by the city signed by the applicant and accompanied by a license fee to be set from time to time by the city council such application shall state the 1 names and residences of the applicant or its principal offices and their residences if the applicant is an association or corporation 2 detailed nature of the business to be conducted and the kind of materials to be collected stored bought sold or otherwise handled 3 premises where such business or activity is to be located or carried on 03 inspection the city clerk shall report such application to the fire chief and building inspector who shall inspect or cause to be inspected such premises to determine whether they are appropriate for carrying on the junk business in terms of whether there is or will be compliance with all laws and ordinances and whether a fire health or safety hazard would be created by such activity the city officers shall report their findings to the council at its next regular meeting 04 term the council shall act upon all applications and in its discretion shall grant a license to conduct the junk business for a period not to exceed one year after expiration of one year the applicant must resubmit a new application pursuant to this division 05 revocation and suspension the council may suspend or revoke the license of any junk dealer after notice and hearing and upon showing that the junk dealer 1 has been convicted of theft or receiving stolen goods or conspiracy to commit either  2 has stolen goods in possession and refuses to permit a law enforcement officer to examine them during usual business hours  3 purchases property from a person under lawful age without written consent of the persons parent or guardian  4 has failed to or is not competent to operate the licensed business in a manner consistent with public health safety and welfare andor good morals  5 failed to comply with the provisions of this article or any provision of law applicable to the premises equipment or operation of the licensed business  6 has obtained his license fraud misrepresentation or misstatement of material fact  7 has conducted business in such a manner as to maintain a nuisance  or 8 is no longer operating or carrying on business 07 state law reference a junk or secondhand dealer is subject to penalties of a misdemeanor for possessing stolen goods and refusing inspection of them by a law enforcement officer or unlawfully purchasing property from a minor minn stats   secs 1038610410  reserved division 3  restrictions premises requirements the following general operating requirements shall apply to each junk dealers license in accordance with this division 06intro  plainly displayed the license issued pursuant to division 4 of this chapter shall be plainly displayed on the business premises 061 premises in sanitary condition the premises on which the junk business is carried on shall at all times be maintained in a sanitary condition 062 no unlicensed land or space no land or space not covered by the license shall be used in the licensed business 063 standing water no water shall be allowed to stand in any place on the premises in such a manner as to afford a breeding place for mosquitoes 064 vegetation weeds and vegetation on the premises other than trees and shrubs shall be kept at a height of not more than eight inches no garbage or waste liable to give off a foul odor or attract vermin shall be kept on the premises 065 location no junk shall be allowed to rest upon or protrude over any public street sidewalk or curb or become scattered or blow off the business premises 066 buffer zone a there shall be maintained a buffer zone of not less than ten feet between any public street or rightofway bordering such licensed premises and the area on such licensed premises wherein the licensee keeps stores or piles the junk or articles for sale within which buffer zone no junk shall be kept stored or piled the buffer zone shall be landscaped with the planting of appropriate grass andor sod and trees and shrubbery which shall be maintained and kept by the licensee in a presentable appearance b any junkyard located within onehalf mile of any rightofway of any trunk highway including interstate highways shall be screened to effectively conceal it from view of motorists 067 state law reference unauthorized junkyards prohibited minn stats   subd 3 storage junk shall be stored in piles not exceeding six feet in height and shall be arranged in a neat and tidy manner with accessways between rows sufficient to allow easy firefighting access to all areas of the premises wherein junk is kept stored or piled 068 combustible materials no combustible material of any kind not necessary or beneficial to the licensed premises shall be kept on the premises nor shall the premises be allowed to become a fire hazard 069 gasoline and oil all gasoline and oil shall be removed from any inoperative engines or motor vehicles on the premises 0610 no burning no junk or material shall be burned on the licensed premises 0611 cross reference fire prevention and protection ch 18 noise no noisy processing of junk or other noisy activity shall be carried on in connection with the licensed premises on sunday christmas thanksgiving or at any time between the hours of  pm and  am 0612 cross reference noise  1671 et seq enclosures entrances and exits the area on the premises where junk is kept stored or piled other than indoors shall be enclosed except for entrances and exits with a solid vertical wall or fence of a minimum height of six feet measured from ground level there shall be not more than one entrance and exit of a width of not more than ten feet on any one side of the licensed premises all entrances and exits shall have a closeable solid gate of a height not less than that of the fence itself 0613 inspection the licensee shall permit inspection of the premises by any employee or agent of the city at any reasonable time 0614 person under age of 18 years no junk dealer licensed under this division or his agent or employee shall purchase or receive any junk for use in the licensed business from any person under the age of 18 years without the written consent of a parent or guardian of such person 0615 no nuisance allowed a no licensee shall allow the licensed premises to become a nuisance  nor shall any junk business be operated in such a manner as to become injurious to the health safety or welfare of the community or of any residents close by b any junkyard not in compliance with the provisions of this article or the junkyard act is declared a public nuisance and illegal 0616 cross reference public nuisances  1631 et seq state law reference ch 2 state law reference municipal elections minn stats ch 205  minnesota election law minn stats  20001211c09 election date the regular city election shall be held on the first tuesday after the first monday in november of each evennumbered year 01 state law reference date of elections minn stats  20507 terms of office the mayor shall serve a term of two years the councilmembers shall serve terms of four years 02 state law reference officers terms minn stats  41202  emergency management footnotes  1  cross reference businesses ch 10 state law reference minnesota emergency management act of 199 minn stats  12011246 article i  in general policy and purpose because of the existing possibility of the occurrence of disasters of unprecedented size and destruction resulting from fire flood tornado blizzard destructive winds or other natural causes or from sabotage or hostile action or from hazardous material mishaps of catastrophic measure or other major incidents and in order to ensure that preparations of the city will be adequate to deal with such disasters and generally  to provide for the common defense  to protect the public peace health and safety  and to preserve the lives and property of the people of this city it is found and declared to be necessary to 1 establish a city emergency management organization responsible for assisting a city in planning and preparation for emergency government operations in time of disasters 2 provide for the exercise of necessary powers during emergencies and disasters 3 provide for the rendering of mutual aid between the city and other political subdivisions with respect to the carrying out of emergency preparedness functions 4 comply with the provisions of minn stats ch 12 known as the minnesota emergency management act of 1996 5 to participate as a member of the lake minnetonka regional emergency management preparedness planning and review committee and review and accept its emergency plan as the citys basic plan for responses to emergencies disasters major incidents mutual aid and other projects consistent with ordinance and minn stats ch 12  1121999 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning disaster means a situation which creates an immediate and serious impairment to the health and safety of any person or a situation which has resulted in or is likely to result in major loss to property and for which traditional sources of relief and assistance within the affected area are unable to repair or prevent the injury or loss state law reference definition of disaster minn stats  1203 subd 2 emergency means an unforeseen combination of circumstances that calls for immediate action to respond or prevent a disaster from developing or occurring state law reference definition of emergency minn stats  1203 subd 3 emergency management means the preparation for and the carrying out of all emergency functions to prevent minimize and repair injury and damage resulting from disasters caused by fire flood tornado and other acts of nature or from sabotage hostile action industrial hazardous material mishaps or other major incidents these functions include without limitation firefighting services police services emergency medical services engineering warning services communications radiological chemical evacuation congregate care emergency transportation existing or properly assigned functions of plant protection temporary restoration of public utility services and other functions related to civil protection together with all other activities necessary or incidental for carrying out these functions emergency management includes those activities sometimes referred to as civil defense or emergency preparedness functions state law reference definition of emergency management minn stats  1203 subd 4 emergency management forces means the total personnel resources engaged in citylevel emergency management functions in accordance with the provision of this chapter or any rule or order under this chapter this includes personnel from city departments authorized volunteers and private organizations and agencies state law reference definition of emergency response personnel minn stats  1203 subd 4b emergency management mutual aid means any disaster or major incident which requires the dispatching of city personnel equipment or other necessary resources within or without the city limits state law reference arrangements for mutual aid for emergency management minn stats  1227 emergency management organization means the staff element responsible for coordinating citylevel planning and preparation for disaster response this organization provides city liaison and coordination with federal state and local jurisdictions relative to disaster preparedness activities major incidents mutual aid and other projects consistent with this chapter and assures implementation of federal state county and other program requirements state law reference definition of local organization for emergency management minn stats  1203 subd 6 lake minnetonka regional emergency management preparedness planning and review committee means a committee made up of the lake minnetonka area emergency management directors which develops renews and establishes a basic emergency plan  identifies and coordinates training for member communities  and reviews local plans exercises major incidents and disaster responses which are consistent with this chapter state law reference regional disaster offices minn stats  1224 major incident means any incident that exhausts local resources  1121999 cross reference definitions generally  12 secs 1431430  reserved article ii  local organization footnotes  2  state law reference local emergency management organizations minn stats  1225 established the city designates the police department of the city of orono and the fire department of long lake the director  1121999 powers and duties of the director a the director shall represent the city on any regional or state conference for emergency management the director may develop additional mutual aid agreements with other political subdivisions of the state for reciprocal emergency management aid and assistance in an emergency too great to be dealt with unassisted and shall present such agreements to the city for its action such arrangements shall be consistent with the emergency plan the director shall also be the citys representative on the lake minnetonka regional emergency management preparedness planning and review committee b the director shall work with the city to make assessments of personnel businesses and industries resources and facilities of the city as deemed necessary to determine their adequacy for emergency management and to plan for their most efficient use in time of an emergency major incident or disaster c the director shall prepare a comprehensive emergency plan for the emergency preparedness of the city and shall present such plan to the city for its approval when the council has approved the plan by motion it shall be the duty of all city agencies and all emergency preparedness forces of the city to perform the duties and functions assigned by the plan as approved the plan may be modified in like manner from time to time the director shall coordinate the basic emergency management activities of the city to the end that they shall be consistent and fully integrated with the basic emergency plan of the lake minnetonka regional emergency management preparedness planning and review committee and federal and state governments d in accordance with the emergency plan the director shall institute such training programs public information programs and conduct practice warning alerts and emergency exercises as may be necessary to assure prompt and effective operation of the emergency plan when a disaster major incident or mutual aid occurs e the director in communication with the mayor and administrator during an emergency major incident or mutual aid shall utilize the personnel services equipment supplies and facilities of existing departments and agencies of the city to the maximum extent practicable the officers and personnel of all such departments and agencies shall be to the maximum extent practicable cooperative with and extend such services and facilities to the emergency management organization the head of each department or agency in cooperation with the director shall be responsible for the planning and programming of such emergency activities as will involve the utilization of the facilities of the department or agency f the director shall in cooperation with the existing departments and agencies affected assist in the organizing recruiting and training of such emergency management personnel that may be required on a volunteer basis to carry out the emergency plans to the extent that such emergency personnel are recruited to augment a regular department or agency for emergencies they shall be assigned to such departments or agencies and shall be under the administration and control of such department or agency g the director shall carry out all orders rules and regulations issued by the city with reference to emergency management h the director shall prepare and submit such reports on emergency preparedness activities as may be requested by the city  1121999 state law reference responsibilities of the director of a local organization for emergency management minn stats  1225 subd 1 authorizing dispatch and use of city equipment and services by the director in emergency situations mutual aid a the city finds it desirable and necessary to authorize the director to dispatch city equipment and personnel to local communities who request aid to combat their emergency disaster or major incident consistent with this chapter and section 1432 b the director shall evaluate the internal needs of the city and dispatch appropriate available aid the director shall immediately recall order and terminate the use of any dispatched equipment and personnel when the need for their use no longer exists or earlier when it appears in the best interest of the city aid requested from outside the lake minnetonka regional area or extended local aid within the lake minnetonka regional area shall require mutual agreement between the director and the city manageradministrator or his designee c the director shall be fully authorized as an agent of the city  and all provisions for compensation of personnel rental of equipment liability insurance coverage workers compensation insurance and all other safeguards and matters pertaining to the city its equipment and personnel shall apply in each case as if specifically authorized and directed at such time whether or not the governing body or authority of the place in which the disaster major incident mutual aid or other occurrence exists has previously requested and provided for assistance and the use of equipment and personnel under a mutual protection agreement or other type protection agreement within the city  1121999 state law reference authority to delegate authority to dispatch equipment and personnel for the purpose of providing mutual aid to an emergency or disaster area outside of the political subdivision minn stats  1227 subd 3 secs 14341460  reserved article iii  emergencies local emergencies a a local emergency including a disaster major incident or mutual aid response may be declared by the mayor or his legal successors it shall not be continued for a period in excess of three days except by or with the consent of the governing body of the city any order or proclamation declaring continuing or terminating a local emergency shall be given prompt and general publicity and shall be filed promptly by the city administrator state law reference authority to declare a local emergency minn stats  1229 b a declaration of a local emergency shall invoke necessary portions of the response and recovery aspects of applicable plans including fiscal expenditures that are consistent with this article and that shall previously have been deemed necessary and approved by the city council state law reference effect of declaration of emergency minn stats  1229 subd 2 c no interjurisdictional agency or official may declare a local emergency unless expressly authorized by the agreement under which the agency functions  1121999 state law reference role of interjurisdictional agencies in declaration of local emergency minn stats  1229 subd 3 emergency regulations a whenever necessary to meet a declared emergency or to prepare for such an emergency for which adequate regulations have not been adopted by the governor or the city council the council may by resolution promulgate regulations consistent with the applicable federal or state law or regulation respecting 1 the conduct of persons and the use of property during emergencies  2 the repair maintenance and safeguarding of essential public services emergency health fire and safety regulation drills or practice periods required for preliminary training  and 3 all other matters which are required to protect public safety health and welfare in declared emergencies b every resolution of emergency regulations shall be in writing shall be dated shall refer to the particular emergency to which it pertains if so limited and shall be filed in the office of the city administrator which copy shall be kept posted and available for public inspection during business hours notice of the existence of such regulation and its availability for inspection at the administrators office shall be conspicuously posted at the front of the city hall or other headquarters of the city or at such other places in the affected area as the council shall designate in the resolution by like resolution the council may modify or rescind any such regulation c the city council may rescind any such regulation by resolution at any time if not sooner rescinded every such regulation shall expire at the end of 30 days after its effective date or at the end of the emergency to which it relates whichever comes first any resolution rule or regulation inconsistent with an emergency regulation promulgated by the council shall be suspended during the period of time and to the extent such conflict exists d during a declared emergency the director is notwithstanding any statutory or charter provision on the contrary empowered governing body acting within or without the corporate limits of the city to enter into contracts and incur obligations necessary to combat such disaster by protecting the health and safety of persons and property and providing emergency assistance to the victims of such disaster the director may exercise such powers in the light of the exigencies of the disaster without compliance with the timeconsuming procedures and formalities prescribed by law pertaining to the performance of public work entering rental equipment agreements purchase of supplies and materials limitations upon tax levies and the appropriation and expenditure of public funds including but not limited to publication of resolutions publication of call for bids provisions of personnel laws and rules provisions relating to low bids and requirements for budgets  1121999 state law reference authority to enter into contracts incur obligations and exercise the powers vested in local governments by the minnesota emergency management act of 199 minn stats  1237 emergency management a governmental function all functions and all activities relating to emergency management are declared to be governmental functions the city and except for willful misconduct its officers agents or employees when engaged in emergency services activities shall not be liable for damage to person or property the provisions of this section shall not affect the right of any person to receive benefits to which he would otherwise be entitled under this chapter or under the workers compensation law or under any pension law nor the right of any such person to receive any benefits or compensation under any act of congress  1121999 participation in labor dispute or politics the emergency management organization shall not participate in any form of political activity nor shall it be employed directly or indirectly for political purposes nor shall it be employed in a labor dispute the director may express professional opinions on legislative or other legal regulations consistent with the areas found in minn stats ch 12  1121999 state law reference no emergency management organization shall participate in political activity or be employed for political purposes or in a legitimate labor dispute minn stats  1244 environment footnotes  1  cross reference animals ch 6  buildings and building regulations ch 8  hazardous real property  8151 et seq  parks and recreation ch 22  planning and
