 reserved article iii  noise footnotes  4  cross reference restrictions on noise for junk  10423 state law reference authority to regulate and prevent noise minn stats   subd 24  no local governing unit shall set standards describing the maximum levels of sound pressure which are more stringent than those set by the pollution control agency minn stats  11607 subd 2  the pollution control agency shall adopt standards describing maximum levels of noise minn stats  11607 subds 24 division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning words or phrases defined in the rules of the minnesota pollution control agency noise chapter 703 shall have the meanings given in those rules aweighted means a specific weighting of the sound pressure level for the purpose of determining the human response to sound the specific weighting characteristics and tolerances are those given in american national standards institute  14198 section 51 cutout and bypass mean a mechanism which varies the exhaust system gas flow so as to discharge the exhaust gas and acoustic energy to the atmosphere without passing entire length of the system including all exhaust system sound attenuation components dba means a unit of sound level expressed in decibels db and aweighted state law reference definition of dba mpca noise rule   subp 4 exhaust system means a combination of components which provides an enclosed flow of exhaust gas from engine parts to the atmosphere holiday means any day fixed by the united states or by state law for suspension of business in whole or in part l10 means the sound level expressed in dba which is exceeded ten percent of the time for a onehour period as measured by test procedures approved by the director of the mpca state law reference definition of l10 mpca noise rule   subp 7 l50 means the sound level expressed in dba which is exceeded 50 percent of the time for a onehour period as measured by test procedures approved by the director of the mpca state law reference definition of l50 mpca noise rule   subp 8 mpca means the minnesota pollution control agency noise means any sound not occurring in the natural environment including but not limited to sounds emanating from airways roadways waterways industrial commercial and residential sources state law reference definition of noise minn stats  11606 subd 15 noise control officer zoning administrator means the zoning administrator or other person appointed by the city council noise pollution means the presence of any noise or combination of noises in such quantity at such levels or of such nature and duration or under such conditions as could potentially be injurious to human health safety or welfare  or to animal life  or could interfere unreasonably with the enjoyment of life or property state law reference definition of noise pollution minn stats  11606 subd 16 person means any individual firm partnership corporation trustee association the state and its agencies and subdivisions or any body of persons whether incorporated or not except the minnesota pollution control agency with respect to acts prohibited or required in this article the term shall include employees and licensees 01   3231995 cross reference definitions generally  12 enforcement and penalties a enforcement 1 when the zoning administrator after appropriate testing has been done determines that a noise exceeds the maximum sound level permitted under this article or otherwise constitutes a nuisance the noise control officer shall give written notice of the violation to the owner or occupant of the premises where the noise originates and order such person to correct or remove each specified violation within such reasonable time as is prescribed in the notice 2 in all other cases the zoning administrator or the citys law enforcement officer may demand immediate termination of the excessive noise failure to adhere to such demand would subject the violator to appropriate criminal enforcement procedure b penalties any person violating this article shall be guilty of a misdemeanor punishable in accordance with the provisions of section 113 and in addition shall be subject to injunctive relief which the city may exercise to pursue court of competent jurisdiction or state administrative agency as may be appropriate  3231995 secs 16731690  reserved division 2  standards general noise standards a incorporation by reference the mpca noise rule   as amended and supplemented are referred to adopted incorporated by reference and made a part of this article a current copy shall be available for public inspection city clerks office b maximum noise levels by receiving land use districts no person shall operate or cause or permit to be operated any source of noise in such a manner as to create a noise level outdoors exceeding the decibel limit set in table 1 for the receiving land use district specified table 1 sound levels by receiving land use districts day  am pm night  pm am land use district l10 l50 l10 l50 residential 65 60 55 50 commercial 70 65 70 65 industrial 80 75 80 75  3231995 state law reference noise standards mpca noise rule   subp 2 secs 169216110  reserved division 3  exemptions nonapplicability a the levels prescribed in section 1691 do not apply to noise originating on public streets and alleys but such noise shall be subject to ordinances enacted from time to time by the city b the levels prescribed in table 1 do not apply to farm machinery being operated by a person actively engaged in productive agricultural operations provided the machinery is not stationary c the levels prescribed in table 1 do not apply to the church of st george of long lake when it rings the church bells for the purpose of calling its congregation to church services and to times of worship d the levels prescribed in table 1 do not apply to special citywide events approved by the city council which shall be preceded by an application for the special citywide event to be exempt from the noise standards and a finding of the city council that the proposed event will not adversely affect the citizens of the city and is otherwise consistent with the public health safety and welfare of the city e the levels prescribed in table 1 do not apply to trains operating on the existing train track city so long as the use complies with all other applicable county state and federal standards and such use is not in any manner expanded in terms of scope or duration  3231995 secs 1611216130  reserved division 4  prohibitions noises prohibited a home audible and signaling devices etc no person shall sound any signaling device on any vehicle except as a warning of danger  and no horn or other warning device shall emit an unreasonably loud or harsh sound or a whistle minn stats  16968 b engine exhausts 1 no person shall discharge the exhaust or permit the discharge of the exhaust of any steam engine stationary internal combustion engine motorboat motor vehicle motorcycle allterrain vehicle snowmobile or any recreational device except muffler or other device that effectively prevents loud or explosive noises and complies with all applicable state laws and regulations and city ordinances 2 no exhaust system on any engine shall be modified altered or repaired in any manner including the use of a muffler cutout or bypass that shall amplify or otherwise increase noise above that emitted by the device as originally equipped c radios phonographs televisions paging systems etc no person shall use or operate or permit the use or operation of any radio receiving set musical instrument phonograph television paging system machine or other device for production or reproduction of sound in a distinctly and loudly audible manner so as to disturb the peace quiet and comfort of any person nearby operation of any such set instrument phonograph machine or other device between the hours of  pm and  am in such a manner as to be plainly audible at the property line of the structure or building in which it is located or at a distance of 50 feet if the source is located outside a structure or building shall be prima facie evidence of violation of this section d social gatherings 1 no person shall participate in any party or other gathering of people giving rise to noise which disturbs the peace quiet or repose of the occupants of adjoining or other property when a police officer determines that a gathering is creating such noise disturbance the officer shall order all persons present other than the owner or tenant of the premises where the disturbance is occurring to disperse immediately no person shall refuse to leave after being ordered by a police officer to do so every owner or tenant of such premises who has knowledge of the disturbance shall cooperate with police officers and shall make every reasonable effort to see that the disturbance is abated 2 a violation of this subsection shall be deemed to be the act of the owner of the residential dwelling unit wherein it occurs as well as the persons on the premises who violate this subsection except that the owner of the dwelling unit occupied by others shall be liable only for those violations occurring after a written notice of the violation of this subsection shall have been received e loudspeakers amplifiers for advertising etc no person shall operate or permit the use or operation of any loudspeaker sound amplifier or other device for the production or reproduction of sound on a street or other public place for the purpose of commercial advertising or attracting the attention of the public for any purpose whatsoever f schools churches etc no person shall create any excessive noise on a street alley or public grounds adjacent to any school institution of learning church or other place of worship g human noise no person shall engage in yelling shouting screaming whistling or singing at any time or place so as to annoy or disturb the quiet comfort or repose of any persons in any office dwelling hotel motel other place of residence or in the vicinity of the source h animal noises 1 it shall be unlawful for any owner to fail to exercise proper care and control over his animals to prevent them from engaging in excessive noise such as barking excessively continuously or untimely failure on the part of the owner or custodian to prevent his animals from engaging in excessive noise shall subject the owner or custodian to the penalty provided in this article 2 the term to bark excessively continuously or untimely includes but is not limited to the creation of any noise by any dog which can be heard by any person including a law enforcement officer or animal control officer from a location outside the building or premises where the dog is being kept and which noise occurs for repeatedly over at least a tenminute period of time with one minute or less lapse of time between each animal noise during the tenminute period 014 5   3231995 state law reference authority to regulate and prevent noise or other disorder minn stats   subd 24 hourly restriction for certain operations a domestic power equipment no person shall operate a garden or lawn tractor power lawn mower power hedge clipper chain saw mulcher garden tiller edger power device for bug eradication drill or other similar domestic power maintenance equipment except between the hours of  am and  pm on any weekday or between the hours of  am and  pm on weekends and holidays snow removal equipment is exempt from this subsection b refuse hauling no person shall collect or remove garbage or refuse in any residential district except during hours approved from time to time by the city council c construction activities no person shall engage in or permit construction activities involving the use of any electric diesel or gaspowered machine or other power equipment except between the hours of  am and  pm weekdays or between the hours of  am and  pm any weekends or holidays  3231995 secs 1613316150  reserved division 5  exceptions permit any person desiring to use sound amplification equipment contrary to the provisions of this division or to create noise pollution may be permitted to do so by the council application to the council shall be made in advance of the proposed event and shall be granted only upon such reasonable conditions as the council may impose the applicant shall be required to comply with all conditions placed upon the permit and shall sign the permit which shall state the conditions upon which it is allowed any violation of the conditions of the permit shall constitute a violation of this division the permit shall require that the permittee have present at all times an individual to monitor the sound levels to ensure that they remain within reasonable limits the permit shall be specific as to time and area 02 exception for emergency work noise created exclusively in the performance of emergency work to preserve the public health safety or welfare or in the performance of emergency work necessary to restore public service or eliminate a public hazard shall be exempt from the provisions of this article for a period not to exceed 48 hours after the work is commenced persons responsible for such work shall inform the noise control officer of the need to initiate such work or if the work is commenced during nonbusiness hours of the city at the beginning of business hours of the first day thereafter any person responsible for such emergency work shall take all reasonable actions to minimize the amount of noise and its duration  3231995 secs 1615316170  reserved division 6  zoning administrator footnotes  5  cross reference officers and employees  261 et seq  planning and development ch 26 powers and duties a administering officer the noise control program established by this article shall be administered by the zoning administrator b testing procedures the zoning administrator shall adopt guidelines establishing the test procedures and instrumentation used in enforcing the provisions of this article a copy of such guidelines shall be kept in the office of the city clerk and shall be available to the public for reference during business hours c investigation and inspection the zoning administrator with the assistance of other professional agencies or persons as may be necessary shall conduct all research monitoring and other studies related to sound as are necessary in order to enforce this article and shall make all investigations and inspections in accordance with law as required in applying the provisions of this article d noise impact statements the zoning administrator may require any person applying to the city for a change in zoning classification permit license for any structure operation process installation or alteration or project that may be considered a potential noise source to submit a noise impact statement on a form prescribed by the zoning administrator each such statement shall be reviewed to ascertain whether the granting of such change in zoning classification permit or license would result in the violation of any provision of this article reviews of noise impact statements shall be made by the zoning committee planning commission if appropriate and recommendations shall be made to the city council e other powers and duties the zoning administrator shall exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as are reasonable and necessary to enforce the provisions of this article  3231995 state law reference measurement methodology mpca noise rule   secs 1617216200  reserved article iv  trees footnotes  6  cross reference vegetation ch 38 division 1  generally planting maintenance and removal a duties of forester 1 the forester as appointed by the city administrator for the purposes of this section shall identify diseased and hazardous trees that threaten the health and safety of the public and coordinate all activities of the city relating to the control and prevention of tree diseases 2 the forester shall identify and describe significant trees in any proposed subdivision or development project and assist planners developers and architects in the development of a tree preservation plan for each construction development project 3 the forester shall maintain a list of desirable trees for planting on public lands with a definition of the size classes small medium large for each species 4 the forester shall promulgate and enforce and all persons shall obey rules regulations and specifications concerning the trimming spraying removal planting pruning and protection of trees shrubs vines hedges and other plants upon the rightofway of any street alley park or other cityowned property 5 the forester shall promulgate and enforce a tree preservation policy approved by the city council to protect significant trees on public and private property b placement and care of trees 1 placement trees along streets and boulevards as well as trees located upon cityowned property shall be planted no closer together than i 30 feet for small trees  ii 40 feet for medium trees  iii 50 feet for large trees applying size definitions promulgated by the forester under subsection a3 of this section plantings at less than the minimum spacing described in this section may be allowed with forester approval when planting to create a screen size variety and spacing will be approved by the forester 2 utilities only small trees as defined under subsection a3 of this section shall be allowed to be planted on cityowned property under or within ten lateral feet of any overhead utility wire or within five lateral feet of any underground utility or water or sewer line 3 disturbance of trees a no person shall trim cut prune or otherwise eliminate growth from any tree on public property without a permit trees severely damaged by storms or other causes or certain trees located under utility wires or other obstructions where other pruning practices are impractical may be exempted from this policy at the determination of the forester b no person shall plant remove cut above the ground or disturb any tree on any street park or other cityowned property without first filing an application and producing a permit from the forester persons receiving such a permit shall abide by applicable requirements under the city no person shall violate the tree preservation policy promulgated by the forester under subsection a5 of this section  secs 1620216220  reserved division 2  shade tree agency rules and regulations and providing for penalty for violation of this division 01 regulations adopted by reference minn rules   relating to shade tree disease program as amended are adopted by the office of the city clerk 02 state law reference authority to adopt by reference any statute code or pertinent administrative rule of any department of the state minn stats  47162 stockpiling the stockpiling of bark bearing elm wood within the city is permitted during the period from september 15 of any given year any such wood not utilized by april 1 of any year must then be removed and disposed of as provided by this division and the regulations incorporated by this division 03 state law reference stockpiling and storage of elm logs minn rules   dutch elm disease control policy declaration the council intends following policy to control and prevent the spread of the dutch elm disease which is threatening the health of the elm trees within the city 1 tree inspector the powers and duties of the tree inspector as set forth in this section are conferred upon the operations superintendent it is the duty of the tree inspector to coordinate under the direction and control of the council all activities of the city relating to the control and prevention of dutch elm disease he shall recommend to the council the details of a program for the control of dutch elm disease and perform the duties incident to such a program adopted by the council state law reference qualifications of a tree inspector minn rules   2 dutch elm disease program the council intends to conduct a program of plant pest control pursuant to all the powers of this city including the authority granted by minn stats   this program is directed specifically at the control and elimination of dutch elm disease fungus and elm bark beetles and is undertaken at the recommendation of the state commissioner of agriculture the city tree inspector shall act as coordinator between the commissioner of agriculture and the council in the conduct of this program 3 nuisances declared the following things are public nuisances whenever they may be found within the city a any living or standing elm tree infected to any degree with the dutch elm disease fungus ceratocystis ulmi buisman moreau or which harbors any of the elm bark beetle scolytus multistriatus eichh or hylungopinus rufipes marsh  b any dead elm tree including legs branches stumps firewood or other elm material from which the bark has not been removed and burned or sprayed with an effective elm bark beetle insecticide 4 abatement it is unlawful for any person to permit any public nuisance to remain on any premises owned or controlled by him within the city such nuisances may be abated in the manner prescribed by this subsection 5 inspection and investigation a annual inspection the tree inspector shall inspect all premises and places within the city at least three times during the growing season by june 15 july 15 and august 15 to determine whether any condition described in subsection 3 exists there he shall investigate all reported incidents of infestation by dutch elm fungus or elm bark beetles b entry on private premises the tree inspector or his duly authorized agents may upon prior reasonable notification enter upon private premises at any reasonable time for the purpose of carrying out the duties assigned him under this subsection state law reference reasonable notice of inspection required minn stats   subd 2 c diagnosis the tree inspector shall upon finding conditions indicating dutch elm infestation immediately send appropriate specimens or samples to the state commissioner of agriculture tree disease laboratory for analysis or take such other steps for diagnosis as may be recommended by the commissioner except as provided in subsection 7 no action to remove infected trees or wood shall be taken until positive diagnosis of the disease has been made state law reference methods of identifying diseased shade trees minn rules   6 abatement of dutch elm disease nuisances in abating the nuisances defined in subsection 3 the tree inspector shall cause the infected tree or wood to be sprayed removed burned or otherwise effectively treated so as to destroy and prevent as fully as possible the spread of dutch elm disease fungus and elm bark beetles such abatement procedures shall be carried out in accordance with current technical and expert opinions and plans as may be designated by the commissioner of agriculture state law reference methods of disposal include burning burying chipping and utilization minn rules   7 procedure for removal of infected trees and wood a whenever the tree inspector finds with reasonable certainty that the infestation defined in subsection 3 exists in any tree or wood in any public or private place in the city he shall proceed as follows 1 if the tree inspector finds that the danger of infestation of other elm trees is low risk because symptoms reflect early stages of infection not progressing beyond the 30 percent wilting point he shall make a written report of his finding to the council which shall proceed by abating the nuisance as a public improvement under minn stats ch 429 or abating the nuisance as provided in subsection 6 state law reference obligation of tree inspector to identify whether a tree infected with dutch elm disease has extensive wilt or is showing only early symptoms of the disease and categorize trees infected with dutch elm disease as either highrisk trees or lowrisk trees minn rules   2 if the tree inspector finds that danger of infestation of other elm trees is highrisk that is the trees are dead barren or have extensive wilt 30 percent or more of the tree is wilted he shall notify the abutting property owner by certified mail that the nuisance will be abated within a specified time not less than five days from the date of mailing of such notice the tree inspector shall immediately report such action to the council  and after the expiration of the time limited by the notice he may abate the nuisance b upon receipt of the tree inspectors report required by subsection 7a1 of this section the council may by resolution order the nuisance abated before action is taken on such resolution the council shall publish notice of its intention to meet to consider taking action to abate the nuisance this notice shall be mailed to affected property owners and published once no less than one week prior to such meeting the notice shall state the time and place of the meeting the streets affected action proposed the estimated cost of the abatement and the proposed bases of assessment if any of costs at such hearing or adjournment of such meeting the council shall hear property owners with reference to the scope and desirability of the proposed project the council shall thereafter adopt a resolution confirming the original resolution with such modifications as it considers desirable and provide for the doing of the work by day labor or contract every reasonable effort shall be made to remove all lowrisk trees on private and public property within 20 days of notification but in no case shall it be later than april 1 of the following year c the tree inspector shall keep a record of the costs of abatements done under this subsection and shall report monthly to the city clerk all work done for which assessments are to be made stating and certifying the description of the land lots and parcels involved and the amount chargeable to each d on or before september 1 of each year the clerk shall list the total unpaid charges for each abatement against each separate lot or parcel to which they are attributable under this subsection the council may then spread the charges or any portion of the charges against the property involved as a special assessment under minn stats   and other pertinent statutes for certification to the county auditor and collection the following year along with current taxes 8 spraying elm trees a whenever the tree inspector determines that any elm tree or elm wood within the city is infected with dutch elm fungus he may spray or treat all nearby highvalue elm trees with an effective elm bark beetle destroying concentrate or fungicide or both activities authorized by this subsection shall be conducted in accordance with technical and expert opinions and plans of the commissioner of agriculture and under the supervision of the commissioner and his agents whenever possible b the notice provisions of subsection 7 apply to spraying and treatment operations conducted under this subsection 9 transporting elm wood prohibited it is unlawful for any person to transport within the city any barkbearing elm wood without having obtained a permit from the tree inspector the tree inspector shall grant such permits only when the purposes of this section will be served 10 interference prohibited it is unlawful for any person to prevent delay or interfere with the tree inspector or his agents while they are engaged in the performance of duties imposed by this section 04 conflicts where the provisions of this division conflict or are inconsistent with any other section of this the provisions of this division shall supercede except in instances where one regulation is more restrictive than another in which case the more restrictive shall apply and control 05 fire prevention and protection footnotes  1  cross reference buildings and building regulations ch 8  restrictions on no burning of junk  10422  burning prohibited on public roads  202 state law reference authority to adopt by reference any ordinance or regulation specifying requirements equal to in addition to or more stringent than the requirements of the uniform fire minn stats  299f011 subd 4 article i  in general purpose the city council is concerned with safeguarding of life and property to a reasonable degree from hazards of fire and explosion pursuant to the powers and jurisdictions vested statutes and other applicable laws ordinances and regulations the city council does hereby adopt this chapter and the minnesota uniform fire referred to in this chapter as the fire code for the purpose of establishing reasonable regulations administration and enforcement for the prevention control and extinguishment of fires  providing for the issuance of permits and collection of fees where required by the fire code and providing penalties for violation of fire code regulations  862002 interference with fire department no person shall give or make or cause to be given or made a fire alarm without probable cause or neglect or refuse to obey any reasonable order of the chief of the fire department at a fire or interfere with the fire department in the discharge of its duties 0212   862002 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter the fire code or the fire marshal division alterations and amendments shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning building official means the individual certified by the state and appointed by the city council to administer and enforce the building codes within the city chief means the chief of the volunteer fire department or authorized representative except that for the purposes of enforcement of this chapter the term chief shall also include those persons listed in section 18111 corporation counsel means the attorney for the city jurisdiction and municipality mean the city of long lake as a whole 033b   862002 cross reference definitions generally  12 interpretation and conflict a minimum requirements in their interpretation and application the provisions of this chapter shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the protection of the public health safety and general welfare b conflict with public provisions this chapter is not intended to interfere with abrogate or annul any other ordinance rule or regulation statute or other provision by law where any provision of this chapter imposes restrictions different from those imposed by any other provisions of this chapter or any other ordinance rule or regulation or other provision of law whichever provisions are more restrictive or impose higher standards shall control 251   862002 secs 1851830  reserved article ii  volunteer fire department fire department the fire department for the city shall be a volunteer fire department consisting of not fewer than 20 nor more than 35 firefighters including up to eight officers officers shall be nominated by the fire chief and appointed after confirmation by the city council 021   862002 appointment the chief of the fire department and the assistant chief shall be elected for twoyear terms by the members of the department subject to approval by the city administrator and confirmation by the city council each shall hold office until a successor has been duly elected except that they may be removed by the council for cause after a public hearing firefighters and probationary firefighters shall be nominated by the members of the department for approval by the city administrator and confirmation by the city council all firefighters are required to complete a city employment application background investigation physical examination and physical agility test to be considered for employment as a probationary firefighter following one year as a probationary firefighter the department may nominate the probationary member for confirmation by the city council as a firefighter the department shall submit the necessary documentation that the probationary member has demonstrated satisfactory performance and met the minimum requirements of the position at the first council meeting after nomination the council shall vote to either confirm or refuse to confirm the nominee firefighters shall continue as members of the department during good behavior and may be removed by the council only for cause after a public hearing 022   862002 duties of fire marshal the office of fire marshal may be held by the fire chief or by the chiefs designee if approved by a resolution of the council the fire marshal shall be charged with the enforcement of all ordinances aimed at fire prevention the fire marshal shall have full authority to inspect all premises and to cause the removal or abatement of all fire hazards 023   862002 duties of chief the chief of the fire department shall report directly to the city administrator and perform the duties as outlined in the position description the chief shall have control of all the firefighting apparatus and shall be solely responsible for its care and condition the chief shall make an annual report to the city council at its first regular meeting in january the annual report shall include information on the condition of the equipment and needs of the fire department the chief may submit additional reports and recommendations at any meeting of the council the purchase of any vehicle or equipment to be used by the fire department whether the acquisition is by purchase lease or donation shall require prior approval of the city council the chief shall also have control over the daily operations of the department and the conduct of its members all disciplinary actions beyond a verbal reprimand and temporary suspension must be preauthorized by the city administrator the fire chief shall report each temporary suspension of a member of the fire department at the first meeting of the council following such suspension 024   862002 records the fire chief shall keep in convenient form a complete record of all emergency incidents including fires such a record shall include the time of the incident location of the incident cause of incident if known persons involved type of building including name of owner and tenant if applicable purpose for which occupied value of building and contents if known members of the fire department responding to the alarm and such other information the chief may deem advisable or as may be required from time to time by the council or state 025   862002 practicetraining drills the fire chief or the chiefs designee shall hold a minimum of one monthly practicetraining drill of at least one hours duration for the fire department and shall give or arrange for instruction to the firefighters in approved methods of firefighting fire prevention and medical training 026   862002 assistant chief in the absence or disability of the fire chief the assistant chief shall perform all the functions and exercise all of the authority of the chief 027   862002 firefighters a the firefighters shall be ablebodied and not less than 18 years of age at the time of application for membership they shall become members of the fire department only after a oneyear probationary period and upon satisfactory completion of firefighter i training or the equivalent fire department state and nfpa approved training each candidate before he or she may become a probationary firefighter must be in acceptable physical condition and meet any other physical and mental qualifications which may be specified by the fire chief or council  and each must pass satisfactorily a physical examination which must include a preemployment drug test and a physical exam administered by a licensed occupational health specialist to determine if the candidates health and fitness is sufficient to meet the minimum requirements of the position as determined by the council firefighters shall be able to perform the job duties as outlined in the position description b each candidate before he or she may become a probationary firefighter must undergo a thorough physical examination by a licensed occupational health specialist and submit such specialists written report thereof with his or her city employment application for membership in the department such report shall contain a statement whether or not in such specialists opinion there is any evidence of myocarditis coronary sclerosis or pneumonia or its sequel in the candidate at the time of the examination such a report shall be retained and permanently kept in the files of the fire department 028   862002 compensation the members and officers of the fire department shall receive compensation as determined annually by the city council 029   862002 present members no person who has passed the oneyear probationary period and is a full member of the fire department at the time of the adoption of the ordinance from which this article is derived shall be required to serve a probationary period before becoming a firefighter 0210   862002 relief association the members and officers of the fire department may organize themselves into a firefighters relief association in accordance with the law the mayor city treasurer and fire chief are ex officio members of the relief association the mayor and the city treasurer or their designees shall attend all meetings of the relief association the relief association shall hire an independent professional financial consultant to manage the pension assets of the association and to make an annual report to the city council 0211   862002 active nonprobationary members the active nonprobationary members of the fire department may adopt bylaws regulating the volunteer members the bylaws shall govern to the extent they are approved by the city council and conform to this article and other applicable law the fire chief along with any active nonprobationary member has the right to recommend to the fire department membership a change in any bylaw a bylaw change must be submitted in writing at a regular fire department business meeting and referred to the bylaws committee for review the bylaw change request shall be presented to the membership no earlier than 30 days after the original request a bylaw change requires at least 75 percent approval from a quorum of voting fire department members who are in good standing a quorum shall constitute twothirds of the voting members of the department if a bylaw change is approved by the membership the change will go into effect once it has been reviewed and approved by city council policies that are not bylaws must be approved by the city council before they become effective and the chief shall request the input of the membership when appropriate  862002 loss of membership to be in and remain in good standing in the fire department each officer member or probationary member shall attend at least 70 percent of the meetings and trainings during a quarter and respond to no less than 20 percent of the emergency incidents unless excused by the fire chief during a quarter the failure to so attend without receiving prior approval from the fire chief may be deemed sufficient cause for removal of the member from the fire department the removal of a firefighter based on the failure to meet the attendance requirements may be approved by 75 percent of the voting members at the next regular business meeting prior to voting the member in question will be given the opportunity to explain his or her attendance record firefighters shall continue as members of the department during periods of good behavior and may be removed by the city council only for cause after a public hearing  however the fire chief shall have authority to suspend a member pending such public hearing and only after consultation and approval of the city administrator a member shall receive no pay while suspended  862002 secs 18441880  reserved article iii  fire code footnotes  2  state law reference the uniform fire be applicable throughout the state and in all amended in this article is hereby adopted and incorporated by reference as if fully set out in this article one copy of this fire code shall be on file and available for public examination in the office of the city clerk b the minnesota uniform fire in this section shall mean the edition of the uniform fire as promulgated by the international conference of building officials and the western fire chiefs association that is currently being used by the state fire marshal division rules and regulations and all other nationally recognized fire safety standards such as referenced in the fire reasonable additional safeguards to life and property given the special conditions topography water supply and general fire protection capabilities available in the city b future amendments as reserved division 2  administration and enforcement enforcement authority the provisions of this article and the fire code shall be enforced within the corporate limits of the city authority for enforcement is hereby granted to and may be exercised by any or all of the following persons except where such authority is reserved by state statute as sole responsibility of the state fire marshal 1 the state fire marshal or authorized representative 2 the chief of the volunteer fire department or authorized representative 3 the building official or authorized representative 034   862002 fire prevention inspection authorized the fire chief or authorized representative may conduct fire prevention inspections or educational programs within the city consistent with provisions of the fire code standard practices of the volunteer fire department and applicable ordinances or resolutions of the city council  862002 permits and fees a wherever the fire code or this article requires a permit be issued for some activity or use of property applications for the permit shall be made to the building official together with all information required by the building official or the fire chief and a permit application fee as required by the current city fee schedule payment of an application fee shall not in and of itself require issuance or approval of any permit b the building official shall refer all fire code permit applications to the fire chief of the volunteer fire department or the chiefs designee who shall perform required prepermit inspections the fire chief shall upon request by the building official supply a written report to the building official prior to permit issuance c the fire chief of the volunteer fire department shall issue fire code permits one copy of each permit so issued shall be delivered to the building official for permanent record d no fire code permit shall be issued if the permit would authorize an activity or use of property or structures contrary to whenever the fire chief shall disapprove or refuse to grant a permit applied for under this article or when it is claimed that the provisions of the fire code or this article do not apply or that the true intent and meaning of the fire code has been misconstrued or wrongly interpreted the applicant may appeal from the decision of the chief to the city council within 30 days from the date of the decision 201 2   862002 state law reference if a board of appeal is not appointed to hear appeals from orders under the fire code appeal of orders must be made directly to the local governing body minn stats  299f011 subd 5a  appeals from decisions by the local governing body on issues arising from orders under the fire code must be made to the state fire marshal as a contested case in accordance with the administrative procedure act minn stats  299f011 subd 5 minn rules   subp 2 sec  new materials processes or occupancies which may require permits the city clerk building official and the fire chief shall together act as a committee to determine and specify after giving affected persons an opportunity to be heard any new materials processes or occupancies which shall require permits in addition to those now enumerated in the fire code as they occur such determinations shall be listed  such lists shall be posted in the offices of the city clerk building official and the fire chief and distributed to all interested parties 038   862002 violations  penalties  remedies a generally any person who fails to comply with or violates any of the provisions of the fire code or this article or who shall violate or fail to comply with any order made thereunder or who shall build in violation of any detailed statement or specifications or plans submitted and approved thereunder or any certificate or permit issued thereunder and from which no appeal has been taken or who shall fail to comply with such an order as affirmed or modified by the city council or by a court of competent jurisdiction within the time fixed herein shall be subject to a fine of not more than $50000 or imprisonment for a period not to exceed 90 days or both such fine and imprisonment pursuant to the provisions of minn stats ch 335  5 the imposition of one penalty for any violation shall not excuse the violation or permit it to continue  and all such persons shall be required to correct or remedy such violations or defects within a reasonable time  and when not otherwise specified each day that prohibited conditions are maintained shall constitute a separate offense b specific performance the application of the penalty in subsection a of this section shall not be held to prevent the enforced removal of prohibited conditions c civil enforcement appropriate actions and proceedings may be taken by law or in equity to prevent any violation of the provisions of these codes to prevent unlawful construction to recover damages to restrain correct or abate a violation to prevent illegal occupancy of a building or to prevent continued maintenance of prohibited conditions these remedies shall be in addition to the penalties described in subsection a of this section established as follows all zoning districts 03 secs 1814718170  reserved division 4  fire lanes established the city council hereby determines that the health and safety of persons and property in the city is unduly jeopardized because motor vehicles and other objects tend to obstruct emergency access to buildings exit doors and fire hydrants which obstruction often occurs on private property in accordance with fire code articles the city council hereby provides for the establishment of fire lanes for purposes of ensuring immediate unobstructed access for emergency vehicles and equipment intro  571985  042 intro    intro  862002 parking in or obstructing fire lanes prohibited whether located on public property or on private property no person shall park or leave unattended any motor vehicle in any established fire lane and no person shall otherwise obstruct any established fire lane at any time any vehicle found unattended in any fire lane may be impounded and towed by the police department in accordance with the provisions of section 34231 et seq for the disposal of illegally parked vehicles 04   862002 cross reference traffic and vehicles ch 34 state law reference fire department access uniform fire part iii art 9 secs 901 and 902 minnesota uniform fire minn rules   9041 9042 appeals the owner of any property receiving an order to establish a fire lane may appeal all or part of the order to the city council by filing a written statement the decision of the city council shall be final e 862002 fire hydrants whether marked or unmarked fire lanes are hereby established at all public or private fire hydrants which fire lanes shall extend ten feet on either side of the hydrant and 20 feet in front of the curb or pavement edge nearest the front of the hydrant a 571985  042a  a 862002 building exits whether marked or unmarked fire lanes are hereby established at all building exits required by the fire code or city building codes which fire lanes shall extend ten feet in all directions from such exits where larger fire lanes are required they shall be established and marked pursuant to sections 18176 and 18177 b 571985  042b  b 862002 existing properties the chief of the fire department is hereby empowered to order the establishment designation and maintenance of fire lanes on public or private property wherever and to whatever extent the chief determines is reasonably necessary to ensure open and unobstructed emergency access in this determination the fire chief may confer with and accept the recommendations of the building official fire lane orders shall be in writing and shall be served in person or by registered letter upon the property owner of record or in the case of commercial properties may be served upon the tenant occupying the property c 571985  042c  c 862002 new construction the building official upon recommendation of the fire chief may order the installation and designation of fire lanes andor the installation or relocation of fire hydrants as a condition of issuance of any building permit which conditions shall appear in writing on the face of the permit d 862002 standards the actual size location and extent of required fire lanes shall be determined by the fire chief in consideration of the particular access need and configuration on individual properties as a minimum all marked and designated fire lanes shall be at least 20 feet in unobstructed width shall have at least 13 feet six inches of vertical clearance shall where necessary provide for a turning radius of at least 50 feet and shall be constructed of allweather surfacing capable of carrying a vehicle axle loading of five tons 10000 pounds d 571985  042d   862002 signs and markings when a fire lane has been ordered to be established pursuant to sections 18176 and 18177 one or more permanent upright metal signs bearing the words no parking  fire lane or similar words if approved by the fire chief shall be placed designating the restricted area the number size and location of required signs shall be determined by the fire chief 1 when the fire lane is located on public property or within a public rightofway the required signs shall be erected by the city or by the public agency having jurisdiction over the property 2 when the fire lane is located on private property the required signs shall be erected by the property owner at his own expense within 30 days of the date of the order establishing the fire lane e 571985  042e   862002 maintenance all established fire lanes shall be permanently and continuously maintained by the property owner to be free from obstructions including motor vehicles trailers equipment storage rubbish vegetation or accumulation of dirt or snow all required fire lane signs shall be permanently and continuously maintained by the property owner to be securely fastened not visually obstructed in any way and free from paint or vandalism missing or vandalized signs shall be promptly replaced f 571985  042f   862002 secs 1818118200  reserved article iv  fireworks purpose  compliance a due to the inherent risk of fire and injury to persons and property associated with the sale possession and use of fireworks the city council has determined that it is necessary and in the interest of public health safety and welfare to establish reasonable regulations concerning fireworks b fireworks are regulated by minn stats  62420 in addition to those regulations all display sales storage for commercial purposes manufacturing and use of consumer fireworks shall comply with the health and safety regulations in this article  1 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning fireworks has the same definition as contained in minn stats  62420 subd 1c or any superseding statute as amended from time to time consumer fireworks governed by this article include but are not limited to wire or wood sparklers other sparkling items such as cylindrical or cone fountains ground spinners wheels snakes and glow worms smoke devices and trick noisemakers which include paper streamers party poppers string poppers snappers and drop pops  2 cross reference definitions generally  12 penalty a materials which violate andor pose a threat to public safety may be confiscated and destroyed costs associated with disposal shall be assessed back to the property owner or holder of a permit under this article b violations of this article city ordinances or state statutes may result in revocation of the permit under this article or civil penalties of up to $50000 per occurrence  8 authority having jurisdiction the city council shall appoint the authority having jurisdiction under this article during the annual appointments it is recommended that this article be enforced by the fire chief or the building official  9 permit a no person without first securing a permit shall manufacture store sell or make a public display of fireworks the use of consumer fireworks is not permitted on public property ie parks roads alleys schools government property etc b the authority having jurisdiction shall give final approval or denial of an application for the manufacture storage for commercial purposes or sale of fireworks within 14 days of such application being made to the city c permits shall be issued by the city clerk for a period of one calendar year a license shall expire december 31 of each year the license fee will not be prorated d prior to the city processing the application a certified criminal record check from the state bureau of criminal apprehension bca must be submitted to the city by the applicant andor responsible party neither the applicant nor the responsible party for the permit shall have been convicted of a felony or a firefireworksrelated misdemeanor within the last three years e the authority having jurisdiction shall determine if the proposed location is compliant with state building and fire codes f the application shall include a letter from the owner or other person legally responsible for the property on which the fireworksrelated activity will occur such letter shall grant permission to the applicant for the use of the property g any permit granted under this article shall be nontransferable h the applicant shall provide comprehensive general liability insurance in which the city is named an additional insured for $100000000 per occurrence per individual i the applicant shall provide a performance bond in the amount of $50000 to guarantee full compliance and performance in accordance with the permit and conditions j the fee for the permit shall be as set forth in the city fee schedule adopted by the city council  35 sales and storage a no person shall sell or store fireworks within 100 feet of any fuel dispensing apparatus b it shall be unlawful for any seller of any fireworks to permit smoking at any site containing fireworks no smoking signs must be conspicuously posted and approved fire extinguishers must be available for use c in buildings that do not have an automatic sprinkler system retail sales display of fireworks shall be limited to a gross weight of 400 pounds of fireworks in buildings that do contain an automatic sprinkler system the amount of fireworks shall be determined by the authority having jurisdiction on a casebycase basis after considering the buildings construction fire suppression apparatus and other relevant factors d the requirements of this article are in addition to any requirements imposed by any building and zoning regulations fire codes or state law e only persons 18 years of age or older may purchase fireworks and the age of the purchaser must be verified by photographic identification compliance checks may be conducted by the orono police department to ensure that those authorized to sell firework products are following and complying with the requirements of this article f no exterior storage display or transient sales of fireworks are permitted no manufacturing sales or storage for commercial purposes shall occur on residentially zoned property or properties used for educational purposes or assemblies g a list of all consumer fireworks displayed and stored on the property shall be available at all times the list shall document the name weight and quantity of the fireworks and be accompanied by the material safety data sheets  6 rules and regulations regarding discharge a it is unlawful to use fire or discharge any fireworks along the route of and during any parade or at any place of public assembly or on public property or in any commercialindustrial zoning district b it is unlawful at any time to throw toss or aim any fireworks at any person animal vehicle or object or used in any manner that may threaten or cause possible harm to life or property c the discharge of fireworks shall be prohibited inside a building and within 15 feet of any building d the authority having jurisdiction may ban the use of fireworks if dry windy or other unsafe conditions occur e juveniles may not possess fireworks unless under the direct supervision of a responsible adult f fireworks may not be discharged in such a manner that may create a nuisance nor between the hours of  pm and  am  7 offenses and miscellaneous provisions footnotes  1  cross reference traffic and vehicles ch 34 state law reference authority to provide years the term does not include persons under 18 years who are married or have been legally emancipated parent means birth parents adoptive parents and stepparents proprietor means an individual firm body part or organ cross reference definitions generally  12 prohibited acts a it is unlawful for a juvenile under the age of 12 years to be present in any public place or establishment within the b and c of this section e it is unlawful for a proprietor of an establishment within the city to knowingly permit a juvenile to remain in the establishment or on the establishments property during hours prohibited in subsections a b and c of this section if a proprietor is not present at the time of the curfew violation the responding officer shall leave written notice of the violation with an employee of the establishment a copy of the written notice shall be served upon the establishments proprietor personally or by certified mail defenses a it is an affirmative defense for a juvenile to prove that the juvenile was 1 accompanied by his parent guardian or other responsible adult 2 engaged in a lawful employment activity or was going to or returning home from his place of employment 3 involved in an emergency situation 4 going to attending or returning home from an official school religious or other recreational activity sponsored andor supervised by a public entity or civic organization 5 on an errand at the direction of a parent or guardian 6 exercising first amendment rights protected by the united states constitution or article i of the state constitution 7 engaged in interstate travel 8 on the public rightofway boulevard or sidewalk abutting the property containing the juveniles residence or abutting the neighboring property structure or residence b it is affirmative defense for a proprietor of an establishment to prove that the proprietor or employee 1 reasonably and in good faith relied upon a juveniles representation of proof of age proof of age may be established pursuant to minn stats  340a503 subd 6 or other verification means including but not limited to school identification cards and birth certificates 2 promptly notified the responsible police agency that a juvenile was present on the premises of that establishment during curfew hours earlier curfew the parent guardian or legal custodian of any person under the age of 18 years may age of 18 years in a place where his presence is prohibited by any law or ordinance police authority any member of the police force is authorized to arrest with or without warrant any person observed reserved article iv  public safety alarms footnotes  4  state law reference requisite reporting of malicious false fire alarms in educational facilities minn stats  299f452  intentional false fire alarms or unlawful tampering or interference with fire alarm systems constitutes a misdemeanor minn stats   subd 1 purpose this article is intended to protect the public safety services of the city from misuse of public safety alarms and to provide for the maximum possible service to public safety alarm users this article regulates the use of fire burglary and safety alarms  establishes users fees  and establishes a system of administration 01 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alarm system means any alarm installation designed to be used for the prevention or detection of burglary robbery or fire on the premises which contain an alarm installation automobile alarm devices shall not be considered an alarm system under this article alarm user means the person in control of any building structure or facility wherein an alarm system is maintained false alarm means an alarm signal eliciting a response by public safety personnel when a situation requiring a response does not in fact exist and which false alarm is caused by the activation of the alarm system failure alarm malfunction improper installation or the inadvertence of the alarm systems owner or lessees or of his employees or agents false alarms do not include alarms caused by climatic conditions such as tornadoes thunderstorms utility line mishaps violent conditions of nature or any other conditions which are clearly beyond the control of the alarm manufacturer installer or owner public safety personnel means city employees or personnel duly authorized to maintain and enforce public safety 02 cross reference definitions generally  12 user fee a user fee schedule once a public safety alarm system reports more than three false alarms to the city in a single calendar year and the alarm user has received timely notice of each violation the alarm user shall be charged a user fee as fixed and determined from time to time by the council b appeal any alarm user required by the city to pay a user fee as the result of a false alarm may make a written appeal of the false alarm charge to the police chief within ten days notice from the city of the false alarm charge following review and determination by the police chief such decision may be appealed to the council who will have the authority to make a final determination as to whether the appellant is to be charged with a fee for a false alarm 03 payment of fees a fees paid to city treasurer payment of user fees must be paid to the city treasurer within 30 days from the date of notice by the city to the alarm user failure to pay the fee within 30 days notice will cause the alarm user to be considered delinquent and subject to a penalty of ten percent of the fee b delinquent charges all delinquent charges for user fees shall be certified by the clerk to the county assessor who shall prepare an assessment roll each year providing for assessment of the delinquent amounts against the respective properties served which assessment roll shall be delivered to the council for adoption on or before october 10 of each year 04 alarm report when an alarm user has incurred five false alarms or more within one calendar year the alarm user shall submit within ten days after being charged with the fifth false alarm written verification to the police chief that appropriate actions are being taken to discover and eliminate the cause of the false alarms it is unlawful for any person to fail to submit such written verification required by this section 05 confidentiality a deemed confidential record all information submitted in compliance with this article shall be held in confidence and shall be deemed a confidential record exempt from discovery to the extent permitted by law b statistics subject to requirements of confidentiality the police chief may develop and maintain statistics for the purpose of ongoing alarm systems evaluation 06 parks and recreation footnotes  1  cross reference leashing animals in parks  6101 et seq  environment ch 16  streets without limiting its generality the term pet includes any dog cat horse pony sheep goat bird or any other animal commonly known or referred to as a pet it shall not be unlawful however for a blind or deaf person or a person with a physical or sensory disability to be accompanied by a properly identified and harnessed service animal dogs shall be allowed in public parks in accordance with section 6101 2 camping to camp upon or use public parks or playgrounds for purposes of overnight accommodation andor sleeping the term overnight means those hours between regular or special closing time and public street parking area or boat launch  except that authorized police fire emergency and maintenance personnel may operate such motorized vehicles upon any portion of a public park or playground as is reasonably necessary to perform their ordinary and necessary duties 4 defacing damaging or destroying to willfully and intentionally deface damage or destroy any structure building sign fixture subd 10 hours and reservations for special use public parks and playgrounds open at  am and close at  pm except in the case of organized sports events or by special permit obtained from the city clerk groups reserving these places for special uses may extend their use before or beyond such times a permit will be issued by the city clerk for groups desiring to reserve any park facilities for permitted and lawful uses 03 large public gatherings on public lands a purpose and intent this section is intended as part of a program to promote the public welfare and safety  the sanitation and safety of large public gatherings organized on city parkland and beaches which adjoins long lake b definitions the term long lake means that certain body of water adjoining and partly lying within the city unless the context otherwise clearly requires state law reference authority to regulate certain matters of health minn stats   subd 22 c permit requirements 1 persons organizing and running a public or private gathering or event estimated at more than 250 participants and spectators on any parkland of the city adjoining long lake or on any public beaches or other public facilities for access to long lake are required to obtain a permit from the council state law reference commissioner of health may regulate the general sanitation of mass gatherings minn stats  14412 subd 2 2 a verified application for each permit shall be made to the city clerk on forms provided by the city the applications shall include a the name address and telephone number of the applicant and if an organization the name address telephone number and date of birth of each officer principal partner director or shareholder of the applicant b descriptive information including 1 the purpose of the gathering or event  2 the nature of the activities to be conducted during the gathering or event  3 the proposed date hours of operation number of people to be involved vehicles or other equipment to be used  4 location and size of structures or equipment to be used during the gathering or event drawn to scale and appropriately labeled on a map  5 the location of activities to be conducted also
