approvals have been obtained from all other governmental units subdivisions or agencies having jurisdiction of long lake and its environs d detailed plans to ensure waste disposal sanitary facilities inspections of vehicles or equipment postevent cleanup and other necessary precautions to prevent pollution to land or the lake e the permit fee provided that if the permit is not granted the fee shall be refunded to the applicant minus costs for police background investigation of the applicant andor its principals city staff investigation or other expenses incurred by the city relative to the application 3 the application and information required to be given under subsection c2 of this section shall be submitted at least 45 days in advance of the proposed event unless the city council shall waive this requirement for good cause shown 4 upon receipt of the application required by subsection c2 of this section the council shall refer it to the police chief and such other members of the city staff as it shall deem necessary for review investigation and recommendation the costs of police and staff review and investigation shall be reimbursed from the license fee submitted with the application 5 the council shall act upon the application within 30 days of its submission to the city clerk in making its decision to grant or deny the permit the council shall exercise its discretion and may consider among other things the following a the recommendations of the police chief as to criminal history or lack thereof of the applicants and the recommendations of city staff charged with investigation and processing of the application b whether the proposed event will cause pollution of the waters or shoreline of long lake c whether the proposed event is compatible with activities of unorganized users of the lake andor public facilities adjoining the lake d whether the proposed event will create a condition hazardous to persons or property e whether the proposed event by reason of noise fumes light or other characteristics will tend to be a source of nuisance or annoyance to persons in the vicinity of the event 6 the council may when deemed necessary impose written conditions upon the granting of a license a violation of any of the conditions shall be a violation of this section 7 the permit fee to be submitted with the application shall be determined from time to time by the city council 8 no person granted a permit pursuant to this section shall gain a vested right to obtain such permits in the future 9 by making application the applicant consents to permitting officers and agents of the city to enter the event area at all times to investigate the activities and to determine whether the conditions of the permit and all other applicable laws are being complied with d concessions no applicant granted a permit pursuant to this section shall have the right to sell food beverages gifts knickknacks curios or other concessionaire goods on any public property in connection with the event or its activities concessions for the event shall be regulated by the city and granted only to nonprofit organizations which make application to the city for a concession permit the applicant however may at its option prohibit the sale of concessions by so stating in its application e violations violation of this section shall constitute a misdemeanor punishable in accordance with section 113 04 peddlers and solicitors footnotes  1  cross reference businesses ch 10  streets sidewalks and other public places ch 30 article i  in general secs 2412430  reserved article ii  business and contribution solicitation practices footnotes  2  cross reference businesses ch 10 state law reference authority to restrain or license and regulate auctioneers transient merchants and dealers hawkers peddlers solicitors and canvassers minn stats   subd 19  authority to regulate or license hawkers and peddlers minn stats  32906  authority to regulate or license transient merchants minn stats  32915 division 1  generally purpose this article is intended to regulate andor prohibit certain businessrelated or contributionrelated solicitation practices within the city so as to protect the residents from unwanted annoying or illegal sales and contribution practices and to protect established business concerns within the city from unfair annoying or illegal sales competition or contribution practices 01   52501 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning business solicitation means an attempt by a solicitor to sell or distribute goods or services within the city by means of personal facetoface contact with the solicitee at a place other than the solicitors established place of business it does not include solicitations in which the solicitee previously knows the solicitor hisits business firm or organization and the identity of the goods or services offered or solicitations where the contact was initiated by the solicitee contribution solicitation means an attempt by a solicitor to obtain money from a solicitee by means of personal facetoface contact with the solicitee it does not include solicitations where the solicitee previously knows the solicitor and hisits organization or solicitations where the contact was initiated by the solicitee established place of business means real estate within a twomile radius of the city which is owned or leased by the solicitor for at least 60 consecutive days prior to the date of application and upon which the solicitor intends to conduct business goods means anything of value which is capable of physical delivery to the solicitee either at the time of the solicitation or later and in consideration for which the solicitor expects to receive payment services means work or labor of any kind to be performed for the solicitee either at the time of the solicitation or later and in consideration for which the solicitor expects to receive payment solicitee means the person partnership corporation or unincorporated association to whom or which a business or contribution solicitation is made solicitor means a person who goes from housetohouse doortodoor businesstobusiness streettostreet or any other type of placetoplace for the purpose of offering for sale displaying or exposing for sale selling or attempting to sell and delivering immediately upon sale the goods wares products merchandise or other personal property that the person is carrying or otherwise transporting unlawful purpose means any plan goal or result the attainment of which or the attempted attainment of which is prohibited by local regulation or by state or federal statute or regulation 02   52502 cross reference definitions generally  12 secs 24332450  reserved division 2  licenses applications a applications for licensing of business solicitations or registration of contribution solicitations shall contain 1 the name address and date of birth and phone number of each solicitor  2 a certified record check from the state bureau of criminal apprehension bca for each solicitor  3 the name and address of the business or organization for which solicitations are sought  4 the purpose of the solicitations  5 a description of goods or services to be sold if conducted  and 6 the areas within the city where the solicitations are to be conducted b application shall be made at the office of the city clerk on forms prescribed by the city clerk and shall be accompanied by an application fee set by the fee schedule of the city 05   52505 investigation all applications for a permit to conduct business solicitations or registration for contribution solicitation shall be immediately referred to the chief of police for investigation for the truth of the information contained therein or any other information bearing upon the character of the solicitors or the legality of business practices of the organization soliciting 06   52506 recommendation the investigation shall be completed within ten days of receipt of the application and a written recommendation provided to the city council for hearing at its next regular meeting if the investigation uncovers information that requires further inquiry to adequately assess whether the solicitor poses a public safety or public deception risk the police chief shall notify the applicant information indicating the solicitor or organization has participated in any of the following shall require further investigation fraudulent dishonest solicitation  activity causing property damage or vandalism  violent crimes  or crimes involving sexual assault if the applicant wishes to pursue the license or registration the applicant shall pay the costs of additional investigation if the investigation produces evidence that the solicitor poses a public safety or public deception risk the police chief may recommend conditions to eliminate the risk or may recommend that the city council deny the permit or registration   registration all applications to conduct contribution solicitations once completed and submitted to the city clerk along with the required filing fee shall be kept on file by the city clerk solicitations shall cease after expiration of the permit unless and until a new permit is completed and filed as provided in this article 07   52507 approval  disapproval  revocation a approval all applications for a business solicitation permit under this article after hearing before the council shall be approved by the council if approved the council may in its discretion attach reasonable conditions to the permit which conditions shall become part and parcel of the permit if approved the city clerk shall keep the permit and any conditions attached to it in an active file for the duration of the permit b disapproval the council may disapprove a business solicitation permit application for any of the following reasons 1 recommendation of disapproval by the chief of police  2 evidence that the solicitation permit if granted would cause or tend to cause a hazard to public safety  3 evidence that the solicitation permit if granted would substantially and adversely affect established business located in the city by creating an unfair competitive advantage over such established businesses  4 evidence that the solicitor has no established place of business  5 evidence that the solicitors activities have in the past resulted in harassment nuisance or deception of members of the public c revocation once granted a business solicitation permit may be revoked after notice and hearing before the city council for any of the following reasons 1 evidence that the solicitor has violated any of the provisions of this article  2 evidence that the solicitors activities have created a danger to public safety  3 evidence that the solicitor has violated any conditions attached to permit by the council 08   52508 duration no business solicitation permit shall be granted which exceeds 120 consecutive days in duration 09   52509 secs 24572480  reserved division 3  restrictions prohibited practices a unlawful purpose it is unlawful for any solicitor to engage in solicitation for any unlawful purpose b refusal to leave it is unlawful for any solicitor to refuse to leave the premises of a solicitee when requested by the solicitee to do so c permit unobtained it is unlawful for any person to engage in business solicitation without first obtaining a permit therefor as provided in this article d registration unobtained it is unlawful for any person to engage in contribution solicitation without first completing the registration as provided in this article e fraudulent or deceptive practices it is unlawful for any solicitor to engage in any fraudulent or deceptive solicitation practices f violations of council conditions it is unlawful to violate any conditions placed upon a business solicitation permit by the council 03   52503 exempted practices the following solicitation practices are exempt from the requirements of this article 1 nonprofit solicitations by children business or contribution solicitations by children under the age of 16 years provided such solicitations are for the benefit of a nonprofit athletic religious social or educational organization to which such children belong and provided further that the use of such children in conducting such solicitations is not for the sole purpose of obtaining this exemption 2 nonprofit solicitations during public events business or contribution solicitations from a concession stand set up and operated during a community celebration or public event sponsored by any nonprofit athletic religious social or educational organization having its principal place of business within the city provided such solicitations are conducted only during the celebration or public event such concession may only be operated upon the specific premises upon which the community celebration or public event is being conducted 3 cityauthorized solicitations business or contribution solicitations from a permanent concession stand located upon any public park within the city when the solicitors use of the stand has been authorized by the city for athletic events 4 fire department solicitations business or contribution solicitations conducted by the volunteer fire department or any auxiliary organization thereof for the exclusive benefit of the fire department 5 long lake park subcommittee solicitations business or contribution solicitations conducted by and for the exclusive benefit of the long lake park subcommittee 6 homegrown edible produce solicitations business or contribution solicitations which involve the sale of homegrown edible produce at the intersection of county road 146 and us trunk highway 12 or at any location within the area platted as the long lake commercialindustrial park provided the solicitor shall have first obtained the written permission of the landowner or lessor of the property on which such solicitations shall be conducted and the solicitor shall have first registered with and obtained a permit to do so from the city clerk 04   52504 state law reference provisions for licensing and regulation of hawkers and peddlers do not apply to persons who may sell or peddle the products of the farm or garden occupied and cultivated by building addition or change in site plan  or any amendment to a previously approved subdivision planned unit development rezoning special use permit variance vacation building addition or site plan the city to incur costs on behalf of or on account of that owner associated with a proposed development may be required to reimburse the city for the actual costs expended by the city on behalf of or on account of that owner if the city administrator intends to seek reimbursement of city costs to be incurred he shall notify the applicant and place the matter on the agenda of the city council meeting for approval at any time prior to final approval of the project or as a condition of final approval the city council may consider the matter and determine whether reimbursement of actual costs shall be sought by the city if reimbursement of actual costs is approved by the city the city administrator shall follow the provisions of this article any development which involves only one platted residential lot for a noncommercial purpose located in a residential zoning district shall not be responsible for costs incurred by the city beyond the initial application fee 03   151999 deposit required subject to the provisions of section 26132 the owner shall deposit with the city in escrow an amount as determined by the city administrator necessary to cover the total costs associated with the proposed development prior to the performance of any such services by the citys regular staff or consultants however if a proposed development and the related consultant review is anticipated to span a period of time in excess of 90 days the owner will only be expected to deposit a sum as determined by the city administrator necessary for the city to pay all costs for 90 days the owner will then be expected to maintain the escrow fund at a balance equal to the original amount deposited any escrow shall be held in a special escrow account and shall be credited to the subdivider owner or developer staff time and legal expenses incurred by the city in plat approval office and field checking setting grade and drainage requirements general supervision staking inspection installation and cost of traffic control and street signs drafting asbuilt drawings and all other city staff and consultant services performed in the processing of such improvements and developments administrative and legal expenses in examining title to the property being developed shall be charged to the escrow account and shall be credited to the city 03   151999 monthly statements of expenditures required the city will provide itemized statements to the owner by the 15th day of each month showing the citys expenditures for staff and consultant services for the prior month associated with a development together with the current balance in the developers escrow fund and a statement if additional funds are requested to maintain the fund at the level established no statement will be sent if there are no transactions during the preceding month in the escrow fund the city shall itemize all time services and materials billed to any developers escrow account  and such time services and materials shall be in accordance with the rules regulations and fees as promulgated and adopted by the council the subdivider owner or developer making the deposits in the escrow account shall upon request be furnished a copy of such itemized charges any balance remaining in the account upon completion of all platting conditions shall be returned to the depositor by the finance department after all claims and charges have been paid 03   151999 reimbursement of escrow fund the owner shall reimburse the escrow fund for any deficits caused if the amount actually expended by or billed to the city exceeds the escrow fund balance 03   151999 refund of unexpended balance the city shall refund any moneys deposited in the escrow fund not expended for consultant fees within 30 days after completion of any city consultant services associated with the development 03   151999 escrow fund not to draw interest the city shall not pay interest on the moneys deposited in the escrow fund 03   151999 rates established the city administrator shall establish the rates charged for the services performed by the city staff or consultants 03   151999 state law reference authority to conduct financial affairs stream or other body of water d scattering of refuse no person shall deposit anywhere within the city any refuse in such manner that it may be carried or deposited by the elements upon any public place or any other premises within the city e burying of refuse no person shall bury any refuse in the city this subsection does not prevent anyone from composting yard waste and other easily biodegradable nonpoisonous garbage on his own premises composting of garbage shall be allowed only when application has been made to and approval granted by the building and zoning administrator on a 522000 state law reference mandatory recycling opportunities minn stats  115a552 subd 2 containers a general requirement every householder occupant or owner of any residence and any restaurant industrial establishment or commercial establishment shall be provided by his designated hauler on the premises one or more containers to receive and contain all refuse which may accumulate between collections or other disposal all normal accumulation of refuse shall be deposited in such containers except that leaves trimmings from shrubs grass clippings shavings excelsior and other rubbish of similar volume and weight may be stored in closed containers not meeting the requirements of subsection b of this section b container requirements each residential container shall be watertight shall be impervious to insects and rodents shall be fire resistant and shall not exceed 90 gallons in capacity any commercial or business establishment having refuse volume exceeding two cubic yards per week shall provide bulk or boxtype refuse storage containers containers shall be maintained in good and sanitary condition any container not conforming to the requirement of this chapter or having ragged or sharp edges or any other defect likely to hamper or injure the person collecting the contents shall be promptly replaced after notice by the city c recycling containers the city shall provide to each dwelling unit a container for the separation and collection of recyclable materials the recycling containers will at all times remain the property of the city the owner or occupant of each dwelling unit shall leave the recycling containers at the premises upon relocation and shall maintain the recycling containers in good condition state law reference all containers for the storage of solid waste and refuse must be covered leakproof durable of easily cleanable construction and maintained in a manner to prevent a nuisance or menace to public health minn rules   subps 2 and 4  subp 2  authority to dictate the size allowable weight and other specifications of containers minn rules   subd 2b c d placement where an alley open to traffic is available each container for the premises abutting the alley shall be placed at the rear of the property next to the alley where no alley exists the container shall be placed near the door of the building to which it relates in that case the container shall be placed at the front property line for collection but it shall not be so placed before  pm the night before collection and shall be removed by  pm the day of collection e in the business of residential garbage or refuse collection or conveyance in the city unless such person shall first secure from the city clerk a license to do so and pay the license fee prescribed in this section the city may issue up to three licenses for the collection of refuse or recyclable materials within the city b no person shall engage in the business of commercial nonresidential garbage and refuse collection or conveyance in the city unless such person shall first secure from the city clerk a license to do so and pay the license fee prescribed in this section c an applicant for such license shall make such application to the city clerk on a form prepared by the city clerk the application shall accurately state 1 the name of the owner or licensee 2 a description of the kind of services to be rendered 3 a description of each motor vehicle to be used for hauling including the license number thereof 4 the manner and kind of service proposed to be given the customers and scheduled pickups 5 the route or area to be served d no such license shall be issued until the applicant files with the city clerk a certificate of insurance issued by an insurance company licensed to do business in the state currently covering all vehicles to be used by the applicant in the business the minimum limits of coverage for such insurance shall be 1 each person injured at least $30000000 2 each accident at least $60000000 3 property damage at least $10000000 such insurance shall be kept in force during the term of the license and shall provide for notification of the city prior to termination or cancellation any license issued under this chapter shall automatically be revoked upon notice of termination or cancellation of such insurance and shall remain revoked until and unless other insurance is provided as requested in this section e the annual license fee shall be as duly set by the council by resolution from time to time such license shall expire december 31 of each year this fee shall not be prorated during any calendar year f the hauler shall post a performance bond in the amount of $1000000 to guarantee full compliance and performance in accordance with the license and conditions g any licensee wishing to renew its license shall do so within 90 days of the end of the existing license year h the city may revoke any license issued under this chapter upon reasonable notice and hearing and failure of the licensee to perform any condition of the license this chapter or any applicable law within 20 days after such notice 30  30 9161992  30 522000 vehicles all licensed vehicles under this chapter shall be operated in accordance with the following regulations 1 each refuse collection vehicle shall be marked on the outside so as to identify the licensee every vehicle used for hauling garbage shall be covered leakproof durable and of easily cleanable construction every vehicle used for hauling refuse shall be sufficiently airtight so as to prevent dust paper or other collected materials from escaping every vehicle shall be kept clean to prevent nuisances pollution and insect breeding and shall be maintained in good repair residential collector vehicles shall be restricted to a maximum weight on any single axle of 10000 pounds on all residential streets unless otherwise approved by city council 2 vehicles operating under this chapter for article ii  operation of vehicles division 1  generally secs 34313450  reserved division 2  trucks purpose and intent this division is intended to limit and prohibit truck traffic over and upon certain residential streets and to provide penalties for enforcement 01 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning emergency vehicles means any motor vehicle authorized by law to carry flashing lights and siren and which is used for public safety purposes to respond to medical fire and police related emergencies garbage truck means any motor vehicle designed and used for the purpose of collecting and hauling garbage and refuse for hire and which is used to perform such contract services for residents and businesses within the city maintenance vehicle means any motor vehicle which is owned or operated for maintenance or construction purposes by the city county or state or by a public utility or by a contractor having a bona fide maintenance or construction contract with the city school bus means any motor vehicle meeting the definition of school bus as found in minn stats  16901 subd 6 truck means any motor vehicle meeting the definition of truck as found in minn stats  16901 subd 49 trucks serving residential properties means delivery maintenance andor construction motor vehicles which are privately owned and which are used in making deliveries or performing services to specific residential households within the city 02 cross reference definitions generally  12 state law reference definition of emergency vehicle minn stats  16901 subd 5 prohibited traffic it is unlawful for any driver or operator of a truck to drive operate or be in physical control of such motor vehicle upon or over the following streets apple glen road bollum lane bollum circle central avenue charles street creekside drive dexter drive dupont street glendale drive glenmoor lane grand avenue greenhill lane harrington drive hartington circle heather lane highview lane inglewood street kennedy lane lakeview avenue lindawood lane may street martha lane meadow lane neilson avenue orchard lane orchard circle orono orchard road park avenue russell lane stoneridge circle symes street upper lea lane valley view virginia avenue watertown road westwood drive 01 exemptions the following motor vehicles are exempted from the provisions of section 3453 1 school buses  2 maintenance vehicles  3 garbage trucks  4 trucks serving residential properties  and 5 emergency vehicles 02 violations any person who violates any of the provisions of this division is guilty of a petty misdemeanor and upon the second or more conviction is guilty of a misdemeanor 04 secs 34563480  reserved division 3  exhibition driving purpose and intent the council enacts this division in order to promote the public safety and welfare with respect to certain hazardous driving conduct 01 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning exhibition driving means the operation of a motor vehicle in such a way as to cause it to stop start accelerate decelerate or turn at such rate of speed so as to cause tires to squeal gears to grind soil or gravel to be thrown engine backfire fishtailing or skidding or as to twowheeled or threewheeled motor vehicles the front wheel to lose contact with the ground or roadway surface motor vehicle means any vehicle which is selfpropelled or propelled by electric power obtained from overhead trolley wires used for the purpose of transporting persons or property over the ground whether on or off public highways and whether or not such vehicle is required to carry a motor vehicle registration and whether or not its operation requires a license a motor vehicle does not include a vehicle moved solely by human power 02 cross reference definitions generally  12 state law reference definition of motor vehicle minn stats  16901 subd 3 exhibition driving prohibited it is unlawful for any person to do any exhibition driving on any street parking lot or any other public or private property except when an emergency creates the need for such operation to prevent injury to persons or damage to property 03 secs 348434100  reserved division 4  seasonal weight restrictions footnotes  2  state law reference except where express statutory authority may be granted local governmental units have no authority to alter the size weight and load limits prescribed by minn stats  1698016988 minn stats  16980 subd 1 purpose this division shall delineate 1 the city engineers authority to impose a emergency limits and restrictions  and b limitations upon operation or weight of trucks or commercial vehicles  2 seasonal restrictions and exemptions  3 specific streets with a fourton axle limits  and b nineton axle limits  and 4 weight limitations on willow drive bridge 01 scope the weight limitations set out in this division apply only to vehicles operated exclusively within the city all other vehicles are subject to the weight limitations delineated at minn stats   01 engineer to impose restrictions the city engineer may prohibit the operation of vehicles upon any street or road or impose restrictions as to the weight of vehicles to be operated on such streets or roads whenever any such street or road by reason of deterioration rain snow or other climatic conditions will be seriously damaged or destroyed unless such prohibitions or weight restrictions are imposed the city engineer shall erect or cause to be erected and maintained signs plainly indicating the prohibition or restriction at each end of that portion of any affected street or road and the prohibition or restriction shall only be effective upon erection of such signs once erected no person shall remove deface or cause the visibility of any such sign to be reduced except by order of the city engineer 02 state law reference no ordinance regulating size weight and load limits shall be effective until signs giving notice of the regulations are posted upon the highway affected minn stats  16904 engineer to limit vehicles the city engineer with respect to streets or roads within the city may also prohibit the operation of trucks or other commercial vehicles or may impose limitations as to the weight on designated roads which prohibitions or limitations shall be designated by appropriate signs placed upon such streets or roads all such prohibitions or restrictions shall only be effective upon placement of signs plainly giving notice of such prohibitions or restrictions upon the affected streets or roads once erected no person shall remove deface or cause the visibility of any such sign to be reduced except by order of the city engineer 03 seasonal restrictions except where other prohibitions or restrictions are imposed as provided in sections 34106 and 34107 no person shall operate any vehicle or combination of vehicles upon any street or road within the corporate limits of the city during the period of march 1 to may 15 of each year where the gross weight on any single axle as defined by minn stats   exceeds the limits set forth in sections 34106 and 34107 provided that there shall be exempted from these provisions refuse collection vehicles where the gross weight on any single axle exceeds 14000 pounds and emergency vehicles of the city county state or any public utility used in making repairs to its plant equipment or improvement 04 state law reference authority to prohibit the operation or impose restrictions as to the railroad shall have a yearround weight restriction of 19 tons per vehicle or 32 tons per truck and full trailer or semitrailer combination no person shall operate a vehicle excess in weight to these limits over and across this bridge 07 secs 3410934140  reserved article iii  parking footnotes  3  state law reference stopping parking provisions minn stats  1693216936 division 1  generally secs 3414134160  reserved division 2  restrictions generally the following additional traffic and parking regulations govern the use of highways streets and alleys within the city 1 commercial vehicle no person shall park a commercial vehicle of more than oneton capacity upon us highway 12 within the city limits and mill street to lake street  however this shall not prohibit the parking of such vehicles for more than a period of 30 minutes on any such street for the purpose of having access to any abutting property when such access cannot conveniently be secured from any alley or other side street 2 vehicles for sale no vehicle shall be parked on any street or boulevard for the purpose of displaying it for sale 3 vehicles obstructing plowing no vehicle shall be parked on any street alley boulevard sidewalk or public ground so as to obstruct or hinder the plowing or removal of snow  and any police officer may cause such vehicle to be removed to a garage and the cost of such removal and storage shall be paid by the owner 4 congested district parking no person shall park a vehicle within the congested district of the city for a period longer than two hours between the hours of  am and  pm the congested area is defined as all of us highway 12 from the east limits to the west limits of the city and the south 200 feet of mill street 5 wrecked or damaged vehicles any wrecked or damaged vehicle shall be removed from any street in the city without unreasonable delay and pending removal if conditions warrant the care such vehicle shall be guarded by proper lights or by flares 6 allnight parking prohibited no person except an operator of an emergency vehicle on emergency call shall park a vehicle on any street between the hours of  am and  am of any day 01 no parking detached semitrailer it is unlawful to park a detached semitrailer upon any street cityowned parking lot or other public property except streets as specifically designated by the council by resolution and signposted b trucks in residential districts it is unlawful to park a truck other than a truck of 9000 pounds gross vehicle weight or less trucktrailer tractortrailer or trucktractor within an area zoned as a residential district except for the purpose of loading or unloading c trucks in business district it is unlawful to park a commercial vehicle of more than 9000 pounds gross vehicle weight upon any street in the business district except streets as specifically designated by the council by resolution and signposted but parking of such vehicle for a period of not more than 20 minutes shall be permitted in such space for the purpose of necessary access to abutting property while actively loading or unloading when such access cannot reasonably be secured from an alley or from an adjacent street where truck parking is not so restricted d diagonal parking it is unlawful to park a truck or other vehicle using or equipped with a trailer or extended body or other extension or projection beyond the original length of such vehicle or any passenger bus diagonally along any street except for a time sufficient to load or unload and in such case only parallel parking shall be permitted  however a truck may stand backed up to the curb if the weight or bulk of the load makes parallel parking impracticable but then only for a period of time sufficient to load or unload e twentyminute time limit parking of commercial vehicles is permitted in duly designated and signposted loading zones and in alleys for a period of up to 20 minutes provided that such alley parking does not prevent the flow of traffic in the alley all of which shall be for the purpose of access to abutting or adjacent property while actively loading or unloading 01 secs 3416434180  reserved division handicapped shall be strictly observed and enforced police officers are authorized to tag vehicles on either private or public property in violation of such statutory privileges b parking restrictions it is unlawful for any person whether or not physically handicapped to stop park or leave standing a motor vehicle in a signposted fire lane at any time or in lanes where and during such hours as parking is prohibited to accommodate heavy traffic during morning and afternoon rush hours 02 violation a misdemeanor or petty misdemeanor every person violates a section subdivision paragraph or provision of this division when he performs an act prohibited or declared unlawful by this division or fails to act when such failure is prohibited or declared unlawful and upon conviction shall be punished as follows 1 where the specific section subdivision paragraph or provision specifically makes violation a misdemeanor he shall be punished as for a misdemeanor  where a violation is committed in a manner or under circumstances so as to endanger or be likely to endanger any person or property he shall be punished as for a misdemeanor  where he stands convicted of violation of any provision of this division exclusive of violations relating to the standing or parking of an unattended vehicle within the immediate preceding 12month period for the third or subsequent time he shall be punished as for a misdemeanor 2 as to any violation not constituting a misdemeanor under the provisions of subsection a of this section he shall be punished as for a petty misdemeanor 3 as to violations of parking privilege or parking criteria for the disabled the penalties shall coincide with those required by minn stats   and   571985 state law reference enhancement of penalty minn stats substantial public nuisance has developed with respect to the use of public and private property and city streets for temporary parking of trailers or any other type of conveyance used to transport motorboats personal watercraft and other watercraft as defined by minn stats  86b005 et seq by persons using or intending to use long lake for recreational purposes the purpose of this division is to abate the public nuisance and to promote the health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city regulation of parking of such vehicles in such areas other than those designated for such use within the city  7181994 state law reference elements of a public nuisance minn stats  60974  authority to define nuisances and provide for their prevention or abatement minn stats   subd 23 prohibition it shall be unlawful for any person to park andor leave unattended for more than 15 minutes on any public property street or private property located on or contiguous to symes street lake street or mill street within the city any trailer or any other type of conveyance used to transport motorboats personal watercraft or other watercraft as defined by minn stats  86b005 et seq whether or not hitched junked not operating or discarded vehicles left about the city other than in junkyards or other appropriate places  and such conditions tend to impede traffic in the streets or interfere with the enjoyment of and reduce the value of private property invite plundering create fire hazards and other safety and health hazards to children as well as adults interfere with the comfort and wellbeing of the public and create extend and aggravate area plight  and adequate protection of the public health safety and welfare requires that such conditions be regulated abated or prohibited b under the provisions of minn stats  168b09 subd 2 the city exercises its authority to enact ordinances and regulations equal to or more stringent than those set out in minn stats  168b01168b101 and minn rules   pertaining to abandoned motor vehicles 01 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning abandoned motor vehicle means a motor vehicle as defined in minn stats  16901 that has 1 remained for a period of more than 48 hours on public property illegally or more than four hours on property owned or controlled by a unit of government when it is properly posted 2 remained for a period of more than 48 hours on public property and is lacking vital component parts such that it is in an inoperable condition 3 remained for a period of more than 48 hours on private property without the consent of the person in control of such property 4 remained for a period of more than 48 hours on private property with or without the consent of the person in control of such property which is in an inoperable condition such that it has no substantial potential further use consistent with its usual functions unless it is kept in an enclosed garage or storage building 5 been voluntarily surrendered by its owner to a unit of government or a person duly licensed pursuant to minn stats  168b10 and this article a classic car or pioneer car as defined in minn stats  16810 shall not be considered an abandoned motor vehicle within the meaning of this article private property means any real property which is not a duly dedicated street highway public ground or public building street and highway mean the dedicated traveled portion of any public way between the boundaries of private property whenever it is open to the use of the public for the purposes of travel vehicle means any device or machine designed to travel along the ground by use of city shall have the power by written order to prohibit such operation whenever in its discretion it would be likely to produce damage to property or endanger the safety or repose of other persons such areas shall be appropriately signposted before such order shall become effective 04 6181996 direct crossings a snowmobile or atv may make a direct crossing of a street or highway except an interstate highway or freeway provided 1 the crossing is made at an angle of approximately 90 degrees to the direction of the street or highway and at a place where no obstruction prevents a quick and safe crossing 2 the snowmobile or atv is brought to a complete stop before crossing the shoulder or maintraveled way 3 the driver yields the rightofway to all oncoming traffic which constitutes an immediate hazard 4 in crossing a divided street or highway the crossing is made only at an intersection of such street or highway with another public street or highway 5 if the crossing is made between the hours of onehalf hour after sunset but before  pm to onehalf hour before sunrise but after  am or in conditions of reduced visibility only if both front and rear lights are on an atv not licensed as a motor vehicle is forbidden to cross highways or streets except when pushed across by human power an atv when pushed across highways or streets shall be subject to all the regulations of snowmobile or atv any place within the city unless it is equipped with the following 1 standard mufflers which are properly attached and which reduce the noise of operation of the motor to the minimum necessary for operation no person shall use a muffler cutout bypass straight pipe or similar device on a snowmobile or atv motor state law reference muffler requirements on snowmobiles minn stats   subd 1 2 brakes adequate to control the movement of and to stop and hold the snowmobile or atv under any condition of operation 3 a safety or socalled deadman throttle in operating condition 4 when operated between the hours of onehalf hour after sunset to onehalf hour before sunrise or at a time to reduced visibility at least one clear lamp attached to the front with sufficient intensity to reveal persons and vehicles at a distance of at least 100 feet ahead during the hours of darkness and under normal atmospheric conditions such headlamp shall be so aimed that glaring rays are not projected into the eyes of an oncoming snowmobile or atv operator it shall also be equipped with at least one red taillamp having a minimum candlepower of sufficient intensity to exhibit a red light plainly visible from a distance of 500 feet to the rear during the hours of darkness under normal atmospheric conditions 5 reflective material at least 16 square inches mounted on each side forward of the handlebars or steering device of a snowmobile or atv and at the highest practical point on any towed object as to reflect light at a 90degree angle reflector material shall have at least the minn stats  8488 secs 3428534320  reserved article vi  skateboards roller skates roller blades and roller skis footnotes  7  cross reference streets sidewalks and other public places ch 30 purpose the purpose of this article is to protect the public health and safety arising out of the use of skateboards roller skates roller blades and roller skis within the city the city council finds that there is a substantial lack of statutory regulation on the use of such devices and that there have been numerous complaints of residents of the city relating to their use on public streets and in certain commercial or industrial areas such as parking lots where automobile and motorized vehicular traffic are frequent it is also found that use of these devices on the more heavily trafficked streets and highways within the city and on commercialindustrial parking areas has created a danger to persons and property 01 prohibited acts it is unlawful for any person to participate or engage in any of the following acts 1 to ride or propel a skateboard roller skates roller blades or roller skis while on the paved andor traveled portion of any of the following streets roadways or highways within the jurisdictional limits of the city a any street or roadway in any area of the city zoned for industrial use  b us trunk highway 12 watertown road grand avenue willow drive and north brown road except designated bike routes  c any area designated or used for ingress and egress or offstreet parking within any area zoned for commercial or industrial uses within the city 2 to ride upon a skateboard roller skates roller blades or roller skis in any area within the jurisdictional limits of the city while being pushed pulled or in any way propelled by any motorized vehicle or by any person on a bicycle 3 to ride or propel himself upon a skateboard roller skates roller blades or roller skis on any public street roadway or highway which is not specified as prohibited in a direction which is perpendicular to the normal direction of roadway or highway traffic except for the purpose of traversing the street roadway or highway at an intersection or designated crosswalk 02 state law reference persons riding upon any bicycle coaster roller skates toboggan sled skateboard or toy vehicle shall not attach the vehicle or themselves to any streetcar or vehicle upon a roadway minn stats   subd 3 observation of rules of the road any person who participates or engages in the use of skateboards roller skates roller blades or roller skis on streets roadways or highways within the city which are not specified as prohibited must observe the same rules of the road as required of bicycles pursuant to minn stats   03 violations any person who violates any provision of this article is guilty of a petty misdemeanor unless the provisions of minn stats  16989 subd 1 are applicable in addition any peace officer who observes any person violating any of the provisions of this article is authorized to seize the offenders skateboard roller skates roller blades or roller skis and to hold it at the orono police station in the event of such seizure the offender if an adult may secure the return of the article seized after 24 hours have elapsed since the seizure in the case of a minor the article seized shall be returned only to the parent or guardian of such minor offender after 24 hours have elapsed since the seizure 04 state law reference penalties minn stats  16989 utilities footnotes  1  cross reference administration ch 2  buildings and building regulations ch 8  businesses ch 10
