the city of long lake water and sewer service installation repair and disconnect standards secs 36323650  reserved division 2  water department footnotes  3  state law reference authority to establish own operate transfer or abolish public utilities minn stats   subd 11  subd 1  subd 1ai administration the council shall constitute the waterworks committee and the city administrator shall be its executive officer serving under this article and the direction of the council the water department shall be administered by the city administrator 01 cross reference administration ch 2 duties and powers of the waterworks committee city council it shall be the duty of the waterworks committee to 1 fix compensation of all employees of the waterworks system 2 establish rules and regulations for the design purchase installation testing maintenance and removal of meters which shall be required to monitor all water furnished by the municipal water plant 3 determine the amount to be charged for branch connections 4 establish regulations for installation maintenance and repair of service pipe between the meter and the water main or any pipes connected with the municipal water system 5 regulate all excavations 6 determine the location of a curb box placed in an alley 7 set quarterly rates for all city users 8 set charges for users of the municipal water system residing outside the corporate limits of the city 9 establish a connection deposit to be paid by consumers 10 authorize disconnection of service for repairs or nonpayment of fees 0621011 21015 21017 21018 21020 21023 duties and powers of the city administrator it shall be the duty of the city administrator to 1 assess and levy in the same manner as other taxes any unpaid water accounts against the property upon which the account has accrued in the form of a lien against the property 2 keep books of account of all waterworks transactions including accounts with customers 3 make reports of books of accounts to the waterworks committee 4 manage and control employees of the waterworks system 06 state law reference authority to impose a lien against real property for unpaid charges with penalties for the connection to and use and availability of water service minn stats  116a22 water department functions the water department under the direction of the city administrator shall execute the rules and regulations established by the waterworks committee the duties of authorized officers and employees of the water department shall include but are not limited to the following 1 to inspect at all reasonable times all service pipes and devices 2 to enter premises at any reasonable hour to read meters 3 to keep accounts of water used in the name of the property owner or his duly authorized agent 4 to install water meters which are mandatory upon all premises connected to the municipal water system 5 to turn curb cocks on or off 6 to disconnect service for repairs or nonpayment of fees 1821023 additional rules and regulations the waterworks committee has the power to make additional rules and regulations for the administration of the municipal waterworks system not inconsistent with this article 24 major repair and replacement a major repair and replacement fund the council has the authority to direct the city administrator to create a major repair and replacement fund to accumulate and invest the surplus proceeds or receipts from water revenues in excess of those sums necessary to meet the payment of the municipal water system bonds in that certain council resolution dated  and to cover the necessary and budgeted expenses of maintaining the municipal water system and the city water department deposits shall be made only on a quarterly basis unless the council directs otherwise under an emergency situation the fund shall continue to collect surpluses until such time as the goal set by the council from time to time shall have been met b reasonable and necessary expenses the waterworks committee shall from time to time apply moneys held in the fund to reasonable and necessary expenses amounting to a sum set from time to time by the council with respect to the water system for major repairs replacements or maintenance items of a type not recurring annually or at shorter intervals or for reconstruction of parts of the water system such expenditure must not have been provided for in the operating budget for the water system the expenditure must be recommended by the city engineer and directed by the council c expansion of water system the waterworks committee shall at the time of expansion of the water system apply moneys held in the major repair and replacement fund to the cost of such expansion to the extent that the remaining balance in the fund is not reduced lower than a level set from time to time by the council d principal and interest of the bonds the waterworks committee will withdraw from the major repair and replacement fund an amount to apply to the principal and interest of the bonds due for such year whenever water revenues and ad valorem taxes are insufficient to do so e investment of moneys any moneys in the major repair and replacement fund may be invested by the waterworks committee as provided by law interest earned by investments may be transferred to the water operating revenues whenever such interest causes the fund balance to exceed the maximum established in subsection a of this section f other withdrawals no amount shall be withdrawn from or paid out of the major repair and replacement fund except as provided in this section 3656 25 secs 36573680  reserved division 3  permits application for service any person desiring a connection with the municipal water system of the city shall apply in writing to the city clerk on a form furnished by him for that purpose for a permit to make such connection the application is to contain an exact description of the property to be served the estimated maximum amount of water to be used per month the uses to which the water is to be put and such other information as the rules and regulations shall require 02 permits issued by building official the building official shall upon receiving an application as provided in section 3681 if it is in proper form issue to the person applying for the permit a permit to connect with the municipal water system 03 secs 368336100  reserved division 4  charges footnotes  4  state law reference authority to regulate and charge for connections minn stats   subd 5 rules and regulations the rules regulations and water rates enacted by the waterworks committee shall be considered a part of the contract with every person who is supplied with water municipal water system  and any person by taking water shall be considered to express his consent to be bound by such contract  and whenever any of the rules or regulations are violated the water may be ordered shut off by the committee at the place of such violation even though two or more parties are receiving water same pipe  and the meter shall not again be turned on except by a duly authorized person after payment of all accrued charges 04 rates a the cost of connections and installation of all plumbing between the water main and the curb box and between the curb box and the premises and any service device maintained by the consumer and all extensions made to the service pipes as well as all repairs shall be borne entirely by the consumer the foregoing shall include among other things the cost of the tapin at water main corporation cock curb stop and pipe from main to curb box and from curb box to meter and the meter if the consumer is on the opposite side of the street from the water main a reasonable allowance may be made to him because of extra expense involved in reaching the main all such service pipes and devices shall at all reasonable times be subject to inspection by duly authorized officers and employees of the water department any repairs found to be necessary by such inspection shall be made promptly or the water department will discontinue the service b from time to time the waterworks committee shall publish a schedule of quarterly rates for all city users c persons residing outside of the corporate limits of the city and receiving water from the city municipal water system shall be charged for such water at such rate as the waterworks committee shall publish from time to time bills shall be paid quarterly within 30 days of the date of invoice and if unpaid on the date due a penalty as determined from time to time by the city council shall be added 17 accounts all accounts carried upon the books of the municipal water department shall be in the name of the property owner or his duly authorized agent  but the owner shall at all times be liable for the water used whether he is occupying the premises or not 19 deposits the waterworks committee reserves the right to demand of each consumer a deposit at the time the water is turned on at any property equal to the estimated cost of three months service as the waterworks committee shall from time to time compute and publish upon the discontinuance of the service either for nonpayment of bills or at the request of the consumer of the service the deposit shall apply first to the accrued charges and the balance if any shall be refunded to the depositor upon surrender of the receipt for the deposit 20 unpaid water accounts the city administrator has the power to assess and levy in the same manner as other taxes any unpaid water accounts against the property upon which such account has accrued  and the assessment and levy shall become a lien against the property 05 state law reference authority to impose a lien against real property for unpaid charges with penalties for the connection to use and availability of water service minn stats  116a22 discontinuing service the waterworks committee reserves the right to discontinue service to any or all customers of the municipal waterworks system without notice when necessary in the repair of the system or for the nonpayment of water rents  and when water has been shut off for nonpayment it shall not again be turned on except upon the payment of the water rent past due and reconnect fee and such deposit as the committee shall require all of which shall be paid to the clerk before the water service shall be turned on 23 secs 3610736130  reserved division 5  connections service connections tapping the mains will be done only by properly authorized persons mains must be tapped on the top side midway between the horizontal and perpendicular lines drawn center of the main and not in any case at or within 12 inches back or 30 inches ahead of a hub or another tap all tapins installations or curb stops and boxes and connections from curb stop to main must be made by waterworks employees or other duly authorized persons and in no case until proper application has been made and permit issued if the premises do not abut upon a street or alley in which there is a water main the consumer shall pay the sum necessary to lay a pipe from the main to a point in the street abutting upon the property in question 08 every premises shall have a separate connection unless special permission is granted by the waterworks committee each premises shall have a separate and distinct service connection where such permission is granted for branch service pipes each branch must have its separate curb cock and separate meter the committee shall determine in each case the amount to be charged for such branch connections 09 installation of service pipe no one except regular employees of the water department plumbers duly licensed or other authorized person holding a duly issued permit from the water department shall do any plumbing work between the meter and the water mains or any pipes connected or to be connected with the municipal water system  and such work on the pipes between the meter and the water main must be done in accordance with the regulations of the waterworks committee 10 trenching and backfilling all excavations made by authorized persons in public ground shall be closed without any unnecessary delay and while open shall be protected by suitable barriers guards and lights as provided by law backfilling shall be thoroughly compacted and left in a condition satisfactory to the waterworks committee where excavations are not filled to the satisfaction of the committee the committee shall cause them to be placed in a satisfactory condition  and the cost shall be charged against the owner of the property involved 11 character of pipe and service connections all pipe from main to curb box and from curb box to the premises shall be of brass or copper and shall be laid at least seven feet below the street grade or as low as the street mains and shall be laid waiving enough so as not to rupture settling 12 bond where work is contemplated on the public streets or alleys of this city such person or the property owner shall be required to execute and deposit with the city clerk a bond in the penal sum of $500000 to be approved by the council as to form and execution conditioning that he will save the city harmless from any and all lawsuits or damages by reason of any negligence by such person or his employees or agents in protecting by proper methods any work or excavations on any street or alley and that he will restore such streets or alleys to their former good condition 13 authorized persons and permit holders only no person except one duly authorized and holding a permit will be permitted to tap any distributing pipe or insert a corporation cock in such pipe 14 curb stop and water cocks there shall be a curb stop and box in every service line attached to the mains and placed as near as possible to the property line if on a street  and if in an alley the box shall be located wherever the committee shall determine there shall be one or more stop and waste cocks attached to every supply pipe at some point between the curb cock and the water meter so that water may be shut off and the house plumbing entirely drained 15 checkvalves required checkvalves are required on all connections to steam boilers or on any other connections deemed by the waterworks committee to require one safety and relief valves shall be required on all boilers or other apparatus for heating water where the steam pressure might be raised above 40 pounds per square inch 16 meters every consumer shall provide a suitable place where a meter can be installed under the rules and regulations of the water department the meter shall be kept free from debris and set so that they may be easily read and examined any meter found to have been frozen or otherwise damaged or out of repair must be repaired or replaced at the expense of the consumer and no meter shall be repaired or removed except at the orders of the waterworks committee if the consumer desires to have the meter tested for accuracy it shall be ordered by the committee should the meter register less than 98 percent accurate it shall be repaired before being installed again for the purpose of reading meters duly authorized employees of the water department may legally enter any premises at any reasonable hour 18 turning curb cock on or off it is unlawful for any person except duly authorized persons or employees of the water department to turn any curb cock on or off 22 meters required it is unlawful for any person to take water from the municipal plant except meter installed by the water department 21 all water to be metered all water furnished by the municipal water plant shall be measured by meters the meters shall be of such design as the waterworks committee shall specify and shall be installed purchased and maintained under such rules regulations and terms as the committee shall determine 07 secs 3614436160  reserved division 6  disconnection footnotes  5  state law reference notice requirements for disconnection of utility services minn rules   purpose and intent the council finds that there are certain users of the citys water who consistently fail or refuse to pay their water bills while it is the citys practice to certify unpaid water bills onto the taxes for the properties involved this results in a delay in payment and at times causes parties who have recently acquired such a property to pay for the previous owner or occupants water usage the purpose of this division is to inhibit the consistent practice of allowing water bills to go unpaid so as to be certified to the real estate taxes and to encourage prompt payment 01 disconnection authorized any user of the citys water who received from the city invoices for such usage and who fails to currently pay the invoice shall be subject to the following sanctions 1 disconnection procedure if the customer has failed to pay a bill for water service and the amount of the customers outstanding bill equals or exceeds the amount of the customers deposit the city shall be entitled to disconnect the water service unless the disconnection would affect in any way the primary heat source of a residential unit to the location at which the customer is then an occupant or owner whether or not the same once 30 days have elapsed since written notice of an uncertified but pastdue water bill has been delivered to such customer it shall be sufficient delivery of such notice if sent by first class mail to the address of the user from or upon which he is using city water 2 reconnection procedure once a user has had water service disconnected as provided in subsection 1 of this section the water service at the location disconnected shall not be reconnected unless and until all pastdue water bills have been paid in full together with such disconnection and reconnection charges as the city council shall from time to time adopt  except that the service of certain qualified customers shall be reconnected in accordance with minn rules   in addition if it is determined that the curb box is broken or in need of maintenance or replacement at the time of disconnection the cost of repair or replacement must also be paid before reconnection shall be authorized 02 appeal any person aggrieved by any of the provisions of this division shall have the right to appeal to the council in writing setting forth the grounds or reasons as to why this division should not be enforced the notice of appeal must be delivered to the city clerk within the 30day period following written notice of default and intent to disconnect referenced in section 36162 if such written notice of appeal is received by the city clerk the disconnection shall be stayed until the next regular council meeting at which time the appealing party may appear and present evidence to support his position the council shall then rule upon the appeal and mail written notice of its findings of fact and decision to the customer if the council rules adverse to the appealing party the disconnection shall proceed forthwith unless the council shall in its discretion specify a later date a customer who disagrees with the councils decision must submit the entire disputed payment in escrow to the utility and a copy of the utilitys escrow payment form to the public utilities commission which shall constitute an informal complaint against the utility to be resolved in accordance with minn rules ch 7829 03 state law reference disputes minn rules   secs 3616436190  reserved article iii  sewer service footnotes  6  state law reference authority to construct reconstruct repair enlarge improve or obtain sewer systems sewage treatment works disposal systems and other facilities for disposing of sewage industrial waste or other wastes minn stats   subd 1aii division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning industrial wastes means those particular liquid or other wastes resulting from any process of industry manufacture trade or business or the development of any natural resources superintendent means the superintendent of waste treatment duly appointed by the council 01 cross reference definitions generally  12 clarification of provisions to clarify specific sections of this article please refer to the city of long lake street and utility standards and detail plats reference also the city of long lake water and sewer service installation repair and disconnect standards secs 3619336210  reserved division 2  prohibitions connection with public sewer a unsanitary deposits it is unlawful for any person to place deposit or permit to be deposited in an unsanitary manner upon public or private property within the city or in any area under jurisdiction of the city any human or animal excrement garbage or other objectionable waste b polluting discharges it is unlawful to discharge to any natural outlet within the city or in any area under the jurisdiction of the city any sewage industrial waste or other polluted waters except where suitable treatment has been provided in accordance with subsequent provisions of this article c sewage disposal facilities except as otherwise provided it is unlawful to construct or maintain any privy vault septic tank cesspool or other facility intended or used for the disposal of sewage d toilet facilities except for accessory buildings the owner of any structure used for human occupancy employment recreation or other purposes within the city shall at his expense install and maintain suitable toilet facilities in such structure if any portion of the lot tract or parcel on which the structure is located lies within 100 feet of the municipal sanitary sewer system such facilities shall be connected with the municipal system the city clerk shall forthwith mail to the owner of every such structure in the city a notice of this requirement whenever any portion of the premises on which any such structure is situated shall hereafter be located within 100 feet of any extension of the system the toilet facilities shall be connected with the municipal system within six months after such extension has been put into operating condition e waiver the council is empowered to waive the provisions of this section in those cases where the provisions would work undue hardship against the property owners or would temporarily be impractical because of construction of buildings planned destruction of buildings and the like 02 secs 3621236230  reserved division 3  connections permit required no unauthorized person shall uncover make any connections with or opening into use alter or disturb the municipal sewer system or appurtenance without first obtaining a written permit from the clerk 041 application required the owner or his agent shall make application on a special form furnished by the city the application shall be supplemented by plans specifications or other information necessary to show clearly the location and type of materials used the applicant shall at the time of application pay an inspection fee as shall from time to time be set by the city council if more than one inspection is required an additional inspection fee shall be paid for each inspection 042 costs or expenses the cost of connections and installation of all plumbing between the sewer main and the premises and any service device maintained by the consumer as well as all repairs shall be borne entirely by the consumer the contracting firm performing the installation shall indemnify the city from any loss or damage that may directly or indirectly be occasioned to it 043 connections separate and independent for every building a separate and independent service connection shall be provided for every building  except that if one building stands at the rear of another on an interior lot and no public sewer is available or can be constructed to the rear building adjoining alley court yard or driveway the sewer connection from the front building may be extended to the rear building if permitted by the council and subject to such conditions as the council may see fit to impose 044 old sewer service connection old sewer service connections may be used for new buildings only when they are found on examination and test by the superintendent to meet all the requirements of this article 045 connection specifications the sewer service connection shall be constructed of cast iron pipe astm specification c200a2 or equal or other suitable material approved by the superintendent 046 connection location the connection of the sewer service connection into the municipal sewer shall be made at the place where the municipal sewer adjoins the property line whenever possible the service connection shall be brought to the building at an elevation below the basement floor any portions of the sewer service connection situated within five feet of the foundation wall must be constructed of cast iron or other approved material and if laid parallel to the foundation wall must not be closer than five feet the depth shall be sufficient to afford protection from frost the service connection shall be laid at a uniform grade and in straight alignment insofar as possible changes in direction shall be made only with properly curved pipe and fittings and a suitable manhole shall be installed at any bend of more than 2212 degrees 047 gravity flow problems in all buildings in which any building drain is too low to permit gravity flow to the municipal sewer sanitary sewage carried by such drain shall be lifted by approved artificial means and discharged to the service connection 048 excavations for installation all excavations required for the installation of sewer service connections shall be open trench work unless otherwise approved by the superintendent pipe laying and backfill shall be performed in accordance with astm specifications c1219 except that no backfill shall be placed until the work has been inspected 049 joints and connections all joints and connections shall be made gastight and watertight joints in cast iron pipes shall be either lead joints or mechanical joints equal to asa specification a2111 0410 invert of connection the invert of the sewer service connection at the point of connection shall be at the same or at a higher elevation than the invert of the public sewer a smooth neat joint shall be made and the connection made secure and watertight special fittings may be used for the connection only when approved by the superintendent 0411 inspection by superintendent the applicant for sewer connection permit shall notify the superintendent when the service connection is ready for inspection and connection to the public sewer the connection shall be made under the supervision of the superintendent or his representative 0412 protecting public from hazards all excavations for sewer service connection installations shall be adequately guarded with barricades and lights so as to protect the public from hazard streets sidewalks parkways and other public property disturbed in the course of work shall be restored by the contractor in a manner satisfactory to the city 0413 license required no person shall make any connection whatever with the sewer system or make any repairs additions or alterations of any fixture connected with or designed to be connected with the sewer system without first having obtained a license to do so under the provisions of this article 0414 field tapping installation all field tapping installation must be made with tapping saddle  and all field tapping joints must be sealed with oakum and asphaltic sealer 707 or equivalent or nonshrinking cement no portland cement shall be allowed 0415 secs 3624636270  reserved division 4  rates and charges quarterly charge the owner or occupant of each residential premises connected with the municipal sanitary sewer system shall pay a quarterly sewer service charge set from time to time by the council which shall be measured by the water service to the same premises but will not be higher than the last preceding quarterly period ending on march 31 the owner or occupant of each commercial premises or multiple dwelling premises connected with the municipal sanitary sewer system shall pay a quarterly sewer service charge set from time to time by the council which shall be measured by the water service to the same premises during the same quarterly period the minimum charge for any quarterly period to any premises shall be set from time to time by the council whether the premises are connected to the municipal water system or not 061 multiple dwellings commercial or industrial buildings for purposes of section 36271 each separate unit in a multiplefamily dwelling or apartment house designed for occupancy by a single person or a group of related persons shall count as single premises in commercial or industrial buildings each store office factory or other like unit that is equipped with one or more water fixtures draining into the municipal sewer system separate and distinct from other users shall count as separate premises 062 industrial user strength charge a authorized this section establishes an industrial user strength charge in addition to the charge based upon the volume of discharge by an industrial user and establishes an industrial user strength charge formula for the computation of the charge to recover operation and maintenance costs of waste treatment services attributable to the strength of the discharge of industrial waste into the sewer system and establishes tax lien against property served in connection with such strength charge b recitals the metropolitan waste control commission a metropolitan commission organized and existing under the laws of the state in order to receive and retain grants in compliance with the federal water pollution control act amendments of 1972 and regulations under such act has determined to impose an industrial user sewer strength charge upon users of the metropolitan disposal system as defined in minn stats   subd 24 to recover operation and maintenance costs of treatment works attributable to the strength of the discharge of industrial waste such sewer strength charge being in addition to the charge based upon the volume of discharge in order for the city to pay such costs based upon strength of industrial discharge and allocated to it each year by the commission it is found determined and declared to be necessary to establish sewer strength charges and a formula for its computation for all industrial users receiving waste treatment services within or served by the city furthermore minn stats   subd 3 empowers the city to make such sewer charge a charge against the owner lessee occupant or all of them and certify unpaid charges to the county auditor as a tax lien against the property served c establishment of strength charges for the purpose of paying the costs allocated to the city each year by the commission that are based upon the strength of discharge of all industrial users receiving waste treatment services within or served by the city there is approved adopted and established in addition to the sewer charge based upon the volume of discharge a sewer charge upon each person company or corporation receiving waste treatment services within or served by the city based upon strength of industrial waste discharged into the sewer system of the city d establishment of strength charge formula for the purpose of computation of the strength charge established by subsection c of this section there is established approved and adopted in compliance with the act the same strength charge formula designated in resolution no 76172 adopted by the governing body of the commission on  such formula being based upon pollution qualities and difficulty of disposal of the sewage produced evaluation of pollution qualities and quantities in excess of an annual average base and the proportionate costs of operation and maintenance of waste treatment services provided by the commission e strength charge payment it is approved adopted and established that the strength charge established by subsection c shall be paid by each industrial user receiving waste treatment services and subject to such charge before the 20th day next succeeding the date of billing to such user by or on behalf of the city and such payment shall be deemed to be delinquent if not so paid to the billing entity before such date furthermore it is established approved and adopted that if such payment is not paid before such date an industrial user shall pay interest compounded monthly at a rate to be fixed from time to time by the superintendent on the unpaid balance due f establishment of tax lien as provided by minn stats   subd 3 it is approved adopted and established that if payment of the strength charge established by subsection c is not paid before the 60th day next succeeding the date of billing to the industrial user by or on behalf of the city the delinquent sewer strength charge plus accrued interest established pursuant to subsection e shall be deemed to be a charge against the owner lessee and occupant of the property served  and the city or its agent shall certify such unpaid delinquent balance to the county auditor with taxes against the property served for collection as other taxes are collected  however such certification shall not preclude the city or its agent from recovery of such delinquent sewer strength charge and interest on such charge under any other available remedy 063 additional rates and charges additional rates and charges may be established for industries which produce wastes in large volume and with high organic material content based on a report made by the city engineer or superintendent to the council if such wastes require for proper treatment that the sewage disposal plant or other portions of the municipal sewer system be expanded or replaced the cost shall be borne by such industry 064 sewer service charges charges for sewer service shall be billed quarterly simultaneously with charges for water service bills shall be due within 30 days of the date of invoice and if unpaid on the date due a penalty determined from time to time by the city council shall be added any unpaid charges for sewer service may be certified to the county auditor for collection with taxes levied against the premises served in accordance with minn stats   subd 2 in addition the city reserves the right to shut off water service to any premises for which charges for sewer service have not been paid wherever so ordered by the council 065 secs 3627636300  reserved division 5  treatment individual and alternative discharging sewage treatment systems the improper location design installation use and maintenance of individual sewage treatment systems adversely affects the public health safety and general welfare by discharge of inadequately treated sewage to the ground surface surface waters and groundwaters  therefore to protect surface water and groundwater and promote public health safety and general welfare the city shall regulate all individual and alternative discharging sewage treatment systems in compliance with minn stats  1155511558 and minn rules ch 708 which the city adopts and incorporates by reference secs 3630236320  reserved division 6  violations protection from damage no unauthorized person shall maliciously willfully or negligently break damage destroy uncover deface or tamper with any structure appurtenance or equipment which is a part of the municipal sewer works any person violating this section shall be subject to immediate arrest for disorderly conduct 07 violations a failure to conform with article any person failing to connect with the municipal system as provided in section 36211d and any person violating any other provisions of this article except those contained in section 36271 shall be served by the city a written notice stating the nature of the violation and providing a period of 60 days from such notice for its satisfactory correction the offender shall upon expiration of such notice permanently cease all violations b continued violation any person who shall continue any violation beyond the time limit as provided in subsection a of this section shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and punished in accordance with section 113 c liability of violators any person violating any of the provisions of this article is liable to the city for any expense loss or damage occasioned by the city by reason of such violation 09 secs 3632336350  reserved article iv  stormwater drainage and wastewater footnotes  7  state law reference authority to build construct reconstruct repair enlarge improve obtain and operate sewer systems and storm sewer systems minn stats   subd 1aii iii  powers of metropolitan council in providing wastewater services minn stats   division 1  generally secs 3635136370  reserved division 2  discharges discharge of stormwaters and other unpolluted drainage stormwater and all other unpolluted drainage shall be discharged to such sewers as are specifically designated as combined sanitary and storm sewers or storm sewers or to a natural outlet approved by the council industrial cooling water or unpolluted process waters may be discharged upon approval of the council to a storm sewer or natural outlet 052 secs 3637236390  reserved division 3  prohibitions footnotes  8  state law reference prohibited waste discharges into the metropolitan disposal system minn rules   discharge of waters no person shall discharge or cause to be discharged any stormwater surface water groundwater roof runoff subsurface drainage cooling water or unpolluted industrial process waters to any sanitary sewer 051 discharge of other waters or wastes except as otherwise provided no person shall discharge or cause to be discharged any of the following waters or wastes to any public sewers 1 any liquid or vapor having a temperature higher than 150 degrees fahrenheit 2 any water or waste which contains more than 100 parts per million by weight of fat oil or grease 3 any gasoline benzene naphtha fuel oil or other flammable or explosive liquid solid or gas 4 any garbage that has not been ground in a garbage disposal unit 5 any ashes cinders sand mud shavings metal glass rags leathers tar plastics wood paunch manure or any other solid or viscous substance capable of causing obstruction to the flow in sewers or other interference with the proper operation of the sewage works 6 any waters or wastes having a ph lower than 60 or higher than 90 or having any other corrosive property capable of causing damage or hazard to structures equipment and personnel of the sewer works 7 any waters or wastes containing a toxic or poisonous substance in sufficient quantity to injure or interfere with any sewage treatment process to constitute a hazard to humans or animals or to create any hazard to the receiving waters or the sewage treatment plant 8 any waters or wastes containing suspended solids of such character and quantity that unusual attention or expense is required to handle such materials at the sewage treatment plant 9 any noxious or malodorous gas or substance capable of creating a public nuisance 053 admission of waters or wastes into public sewers the admission into the public sewers of any waters or wastes 1 having fiveday carbonaceous biochemical oxygen demand greater than 25 milligrams per liter  2 containing more than 30 milligrams per liter of suspended solids  3 containing any quantity of substances having the characteristics described in section 36392  or 4 having an average daily flow greater than two percent of the average daily flow of the city  shall be subject to review and approval of the superintendent 056 secs 3639436410  reserved division 4  treatment grease oil and sand interceptors a grease oil and sand interceptors shall be provided in service stations garages restaurants hospitals rest homes or any place which serves food daily to 20 or more persons all interceptors shall be of a type and capacity approved by the superintendent and shall be so located as to be readily and easily accessible for cleaning and inspection b grease and oil interceptors shall be constructed of impervious materials capable of withstanding abrupt and extreme changes in temperature they shall be of substantial construction watertight and equipped with easily removable covers which when bolted in place shall be gastight and watertight 054 state law reference definition of interceptor minn rules   subp 66  interceptors and separators required minn rules    grease interceptors for commercial buildings minn rules    interceptors and separators for specific installations minn rules   sand interceptors subp 1 maintenance of interceptors all grease oil and sand interceptors shall be maintained at the owners expense in continuously efficient operation at all times and shall be subject to inspection by the superintendent at intervals of 30 days the owner shall regularly dispose of accumulated materials 055 preliminary treatment where necessary in the opinion of the superintendent the owner shall provide at the owners expense such preliminary treatment as may be necessary to 1 reduce the biochemical oxygen demand to 300 parts per million and suspended solids to 350 parts per million by weight  2 reduce objectionable characteristics or constituents to within the maximum limits provided for in section 36392  or 3 control the quantities and rates of discharge of such waters or wastes plans specifications and any other pertinent information relating to proposed preliminary treatment facilities shall be submitted for the approval of the superintendent and of the state water pollution control commission  and no construction of such facilities shall be commenced until such approvals have been received 056 state law reference maintenance of interceptors and separators minn rules   maintenance of preliminary treatment facilities when preliminary treatment facilities are provided for any waters or wastes they shall be maintained continuously in satisfactory and effective operation by the owner at his expense 057 manholes when required by the council on recommendation of the superintendent the owner of any property connected with the municipal sewer shall install a suitable control manhole in the service connection to facilitate observation sampling and measurement of the wastes such manhole when required shall be accessible and safely located and shall be constructed in accordance with plans approved by the council the manhole shall be installed at the owners expense and shall be maintained so as to be safe and accessible at all times 058 wastes and waters measurements tests and analyses all measurements tests and analysis of the characteristics of wastes and waters to which reference is made in sections 36392 and 36393 shall be determined in accordance with standard methods for examination of water sewages published by the american public health association inc 1790 broadway new york ny 100 and shall be made at the control manhole provided for in section 36415 or upon suitable samples taken at the control manhole if no special manhole has been required the control manhole shall be considered to be the nearest downstream manhole in the municipal sewer to the point at which the waters or wastes to be tested are injected into the sewer 059 state law reference analytical procedures for determining constituents in sewage sludge samples minn rules   special agreements or arrangements nothing in this division shall be construed as preventing a special agreement or arrangement between the city and any industrial concern whereby an industrial waste of unusual strength or character may be accepted by the city for treatment subject to payment by the industrial concern 0510 secs 3641836450  reserved article v  service availability charges footnotes  9  state law reference authority to establish service availability charges minn stats   subd 3 division 1  generally purpose and intent the council finds that inequities exist pertaining to the connection to city sewer and water services for properties allowed to connect and hook up to them which have not been previously assessed by the city for the cost of construction andor improvement it is the purpose and intent of this article to establish connection and hookup charges for such properties in order to help pay for the cost of these public improvements their availability maintenance and improvement as provided by minn stats   subds 3 and 5 01 sewer connection charges  certification no permit shall be issued to tap or connect with any sewer main of the city either directly or indirectly from any lot or tract of land unless the city administrator first certifies that the sewer connection fee established and published from time to time as the council deems it necessary to maintain repair and expand the system has been paid 021 sewer hookup charges in addition to the connection charges set forth in section 36452 a hookup charge shall be imposed against each lot or tract of land served by the sewer system for usage of sewer treatment facilities lift stations force mains and trunk sewers the amount of this charge shall be periodically established by motion or resolution of the council such periodic revision shall reflect construction cost changes evidenced by the engineering news  record construction cost index initial charges shall be set by the council from time to time per sewer unit defined as each 274 gallons of sewage flow per day singlefamily houses townhouses condominiums duplex units apartment units and mobile homes shall each comprise one sewer unit other buildings and structures shall be assigned one sewer unit for each 274 gallons of sewage flow per day which it is estimated they will discharge and commercial and industrial buildings or uses shall be assigned a minimum of one sewer unit the number of sewer unit hookup charges to be levied against each premises may thereafter be revised by resolution of the council to more accurately establish the benefit conferred upon the premises and the council in making the redetermination may take into account the actual quantity of water consumed on the premises 03 water connection charges a certification no permit shall be issued to tap or connect with any water main of the city either directly or indirectly from any lot or tract of land unless the city administrator shall have certified that the water connection fee established and published from time to time as the council deems it necessary to maintain repair and expand the system has been paid b fees the water connection fees for residential units of all types inside and outside the jurisdictional limits of the city shall be set from time to time as the council deems it necessary 04 water hookup charges in addition to the connection charges set forth in section 36454 a hookup charge shall be imposed against each lot or tract of land served by the water system for usage of the wells pumping stations water storage facilities and equipment of the city water system the amount of this charge shall be periodically established by motion or resolution of the council such periodic revision shall reflect construction cost changes evidenced by the engineering news  record construction cost index the initial charge shall be set from time to time as the council deems it necessary a water unit is defined as each 274 gallons of water flow per day singlefamily houses townhouses condominiums duplex units apartment units and mobile homes shall each comprise one water unit other buildings and structures shall be assigned one water unit for each 274 gallons of water flow which it is estimated they will use each day and commercial and industrial buildings or uses shall be assigned a minimum of one water unit the number of water unit hookup charges to be levied against each premises may thereafter be revised by resolution of the council to more accurately establish the benefit conferred upon the premises  and the council in making the redetermination may take into account the actual quantity of water consumed on the premises 05 hookup charges to be added to mwcc sacwac fees any sewer or water hookup fee charged pursuant to this article shall be in addition to any similar charges imposed by the metropolitan waste control commission to the city and shall be for the sole and exclusive benefit of the citys respective sewer and water funds 06 sewer and water connection charge exemptions a sewer exemptions notwithstanding any other provision of this article no property lot or tract of land located within the jurisdictional limits of the city which has been assessed reassessed or supplementally assessed for the cost of a sewer public improvement project shall be charged a connection fee as provided in section 36452 a lot newly created from a previously assessed larger lot shall not qualify for this exemption unless the council imposes upon it a supplemental assessment at or about the time of its creation b water exemptions no property lot or tract of land located within the jurisdictional limits of the city which has been assessed reassessed or supplementally assessed for the cost of a water public improvement project shall be charged a water connection fee as provided in section 36454 a lot newly created from a previously assessed larger lot shall not qualify for this exemption unless the council imposes a supplemental assessment upon it at or about the time of its creation 07 secs 3645836480  reserved division 2  service availability charges purpose a it is the purpose of this division to recover from users of city wastewater disposal system facilities on an equitable basis the share of the citys facilities costs attributable to such users and to provide funds for replacements debt service and improvements for the city b the city finds it has a limited number of service availability charge sac units inequities exist among various commercial users within the city especially relating to wastewater that is discharged into wastewater disposable system facilities the city finds that commercial automobile washes use considerable amounts of water which is discharged into the wastewater disposal system facilities also they use significantly more amounts of water than previously estimated eliminating wastewater discharge is consistent with protecting the environment and promoting the health welfare and public safety of the city  7151997 generally the debt service for the wastewater treatment facilities shall be recovered from new connections by a service availability charge sac assessed against new building units the following regulations shall apply to service availability charges sac 1 the service availability charge sac shall be paid at the time at which a building permit or a sewer connection permit is issued for all buildings to be constructed or connected to the sewer system on or after the effective date of the ordinance from which this division derives no charge shall be due upon the issuance of a connection permit if a charge was paid upon issuance of a building permit the debt service connection charge for each building or structure shall be equal to the number of sac units times the service availability charge in effect at the time of the application 2 the sac units for various residential commercial public and institutional facilities shall be calculated according to current estimates of the metropolitan council a 7151997 meters a secured meters measuring water usage shall be installed at the expense of the commercial automobile wash operator b meters shall be located in a manner and place reasonably accessible to the city for inspection maintenance and repair observation measurement and sampling and testing at any time without prior notice c 7151997 rates and billing procedures a rates wastewater service charges and service availability charges for the use of and for service supplied by the wastewater facilities of the city shall be established by ordinance and audited annually b bills rates or charges for service shall be payable quarterly 1 the owner of the premises the occupant and the user of the service shall be jointly liable to pay for the service to such premises  and the service is furnished to the premises by the city only upon the condition that the owner of the premises occupant and user of the service are jointly liable to the city 2 bills for sewer service shall be sent out by the city on the last day of each quarter for which the service is billed 3 all sewer bills are due and payable 30 days after being sent out a penalty of ten percent shall be added to all bills not paid by the 30th day after they have been rendered c delinquent bills if the charges for such services are not paid within 60 days after the rendition of the bill for such services such services may be discontinued without further notice and shall not be reinstated until all claims are settled d 7151997 charges as lien each charge levied pursuant to this division shall be a lien against the property and all such charges due on september 30 of each year which are more than 30 days past due notice having been properly mailed to the occupant or owner of the premises shall be certified by the council to the county auditor which shall specify the amount the description of the premises and the name of the owner the amount so certified shall be collected and remitted to the city in the same manner as assessments for local improvements e 7151997 funds from service charges the funds received from the collection of charges authorized by this division shall be deposited as collected in the city capital revolving fund and shall be used for the operation maintenance debt service replacement and improvement of the city wastewater disposal system f 7151997 powers and authority of city a the city has the right to enforce this division including but not limited to the recovery of delinquent charges and may seek all available remedies in any court of competent jurisdiction any person violating any of the provisions of this division shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and punished in accordance with section 113 any person violating any of the provisions of this division shall become liable to the city for any expense loss or damage including but not limited to attorneys fees expert fees or engineering fees occasioned by the city by reason of such violation b any person found to be violating any provisions of this division shall be served by the city with written notice stating the nature of the violation and providing a reasonable time limit for its satisfactory correction any person who continues any violation beyond the time limit shall be in breach of the service contract and shall be temporarily disconnected from the wastewater disposal system facilities such disconnection and reconnection shall be at the total expense of the customer c if any person fails to come into compliance with this division the city reserves the right to close such use and may disconnect water or waste connections until the operation complies with this division any closing or disconnection by the city shall be preceded by written notice and a hearing before the city council the notice shall give at least ten days notice of the time and place of the hearing and shall state the nature of the charges against the user the notice shall be mailed by regular and certified mail to the owner of the property d if any person exceeds his sewer availability charge sac unit allocation the city reserves the right to close the business operation responsible for the excess sac unit use and may disconnect water or wastewater connections until compliance with this division for purposes of determining compliance with this division the city shall average the sac unit consumption by the operation over the past 12 months any closing or disconnection by the city shall be preceded by written notice and a hearing before the city council the notice shall give at least ten days notice of the time and place of the hearing and shall state the nature of the charges against the user the notice shall be mailed by regular and certified mail to the owner of the property e the city shall be permitted to gain access to such properties as may be necessary for the purpose of inspection maintenance and repair observation measurement sampling and testing in accordance with provisions of this division f where acids and chemicals damaging to sewer lines or treatment processes are released to the sewer causing rapid deterioration of these structures or interfering with proper treatment of sewage the city is authorized to immediately terminate service by such measures as are necessary to protect the facilities g any additional costs caused by discharges to the treatment works of toxins or other incompatible wastes including the costs of restoring wastewater treatment services cleanup and restoration of the receiving waters and environmental and sludge disposal shall be borne by the discharger of such wastes at no expense to the city h as a condition of use the city shall be granted access by industrial users to information regarding industrial processes which have a direct bearing on the type and source of discharges to the wastewater collection system i all work performed on private property by the city in the course of operating and maintaining the citys sewer utility shall be performed in full accordance with a duly negotiated and executed easement j the city and its authorized employees shall observe all applicable safety rules while performing work on private property and the city shall hold the owner blameless for injury or death except as such may be caused by negligence or failure of the owner to maintain safe conditions h 7151997 commercial automobile wastes a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning commercial automobile wash means a building or portion of a building containing facilities for washing automobiles using production line methods with a chain conveyor blowers steamcleaning devices or other mechanical devices b sac unit limitation the metropolitan council estimates that commercial automobile washes use or consume 25 local service availability charge sac units and 25 metropolitan council service availability charge sac units commercial automobile washer operators have represented that reasonable technologies exist to limit the consumption of sac units to 15 units accordingly the city limits the allocation of sac units to commercial automobile washes to 15 units unless otherwise agreed to in writing by a majority vote of the city council b 7151997 secs 3648936520  reserved article vi  stormwater utility system general operation the city stormwater system shall be operated as public utility pursuant to minn stats   from which revenues will be derived subject to the provisions of this article and state law  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning monthly stormwater utility revenue means the estimated monthly expenditures for planning and inventories capital expenditures personnel and equipment and operation of the stormwater utility in accordance with established city policy stormwater utility fee means the annual charge developed for each parcel of land utility factor means the ratio of runoff volume in inches for a particular land use to the runoff volume in inches for an average singlefamily residential assuming a twoinch rainfall and natural resources conservation services nrcs type b soil conditions  cross reference definitions generally  12 stormwater utility factors a the stormwater management fee shall be determined by first determining the percentage of total runoff in the city which is attributed to singlefamily residential property the fee per acre for singlefamily residential is computed by computing the product of the runoff percentage and the monthly stormwater utility revenue divided by the estimated total acres of singlefamily residential land use in the city the peracre fee for all other individual parcels shall be defined as the product of the singlefamily residential peracre fee the appropriate utility factor and the total acreage of the parcel singlefamily residential parcels shall be assessed on a perhousehold basis b the utility factors for various land uses are shown in the following table classification land use 1 utility factor 1 residential 100 2 commercial 423 3 industrial 330 4 publicquasipublic 222 5 parksopen spacecemeteries exempt 6 road rightofway exempt 7 lakesstreamswetlands exempt 8 vacant exempt 9 churchesschoolsinstitutions 374 10 multifamily residential  apartmentscondostownhomes 130 1 land use categories match those found in the citys comprehensive plan which form the basis of the study stormwater utility a special report to the long lake city council by short elliot hendrickson inc seh the study provides the basis for the utility factor rates generally these land use categories will correspond to the residential business and industrial categories found in the citys zoning ordinance according to the study seh will identify each parcels land uses after passage of the policy based on the tax parcel map p 43  credits the council may adopt fee schedules by resolution for adjustment of the stormwater management fees information to justify a fee adjustment must be supplied by the property owner such adjustments of fees shall not be retroactive credits will be reviewed regularly by a staff committee  exemptions the following land uses are exempt from the stormwater management fee 1 public road rightofway 2 lakes 3 wetlands 4 city property  payment of fee stormwater utility fees shall be billed every quarter with water and sanitary sewer bills the fee shall be due and payable on the same terms as water and sanitary sewer utility bills any prepayment or overpayment of charges shall be retained by the city and applied against subsequent fees  appeal of fee if a property owner or person responsible for paying the stormwater management fee believes that a particular assigned fee is incorrect such a person may request that the fee be recomputed  penalty for late payment each billing for stormwater utility fees not paid when due shall incur a penalty charge as determined by the city council from time to time  certifications of pastdue fees on taxes if any two consecutive stormwater utility fees have not been paid when due a penalty as set forth on section 36528 shall be added to the amount due any such pastdue fees may then be certified to the county auditor for collection with real estate taxes on the following year pursuant to minn stats   subd 3 in addition the city shall also have the right to bring a civil action or to take other legal remedies to collect unpaid fees  vegetation footnotes  1  cross reference buildings and building regulations ch 8 general secs 3813830  reserved article ii  noxious weeds grass and certain other vegetation footnotes  2  state law reference minnesota noxious weed law minn stats  1875 et seq purpose this article is intended to preserve the health welfare and wellbeing of the citizens of the city and to preserve and protect the quality of their environment 01 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning noxious weed means an annual biennial or perennial plant that the commissioner of agriculture designates to be injurious to public health the environment the public roads crops livestock or other property the term does not include any vegetation naturally growing in areas designated as official wetlands within the city or such vegetation as the council deems to be too burdensome to regularly remove or cut by reason of the terrain on which it grows after application for a waiver of the provisions of this article made by the owner or occupant of the land in question to the council 02 cross reference definitions generally  12 state law reference definition of noxious weed minn stats  1877 subd 8 cutting and removal of noxious weeds grass etc it is unlawful for any owner lessee or occupant or any agent servant representative or employee of any such owner lessee or occupant having control of any part of a lot or land in the city to permit or maintain on any such lot or land or on or along the adjacent sidewalk street or alley between the property line and the curb or middle of the alley or for ten feet or to the curb or street outside the property line if there be no curb any growth of noxious weeds grass brush or other rank vegetation to a greater height than eight inches on the average or any accumulation of dead noxious weeds grass or brush it is also unlawful for any such person to cause suffer or allow poison ivy ragweed or other poisonous plants or plants detrimental to health to grow on any such lot or land in such manner that any part of such ivy ragweed or other poisonous or harmful weed extends upon overhangs or borders any public place or allows seed pollen or other poisonous particles or emanations to be carried air into any public place 03 state law reference authority of local weed inspector to order the control or eradication of noxious weeds on any land within the state minn stats  1879 subd 5 duty of owner lessee or occupant it is the duty of any owner lessee or occupant of any lot or land to cut and remove or cause to be cut and removed all such noxious weeds as often as may be necessary to comply with the provisions of section 3831  provided that cutting and removing such weeds at least once in every two weeks between may 15 and september 15 is deemed to be a compliance with this section 04 state law reference responsibility of owner or occupant of land or person charged with maintenance of public land to control or eradicate noxious weeds as ordered by local weed inspector minn stats  1875 subd 1 when city to do work if the provisions of this article are not complied with the weed inspector shall serve in the same manner as a summons in a civil action in the district court or by certified mail written notice upon the owner lessee or occupant or any person having the care or control of any such lot or land to comply with the provisions of this article the recipient of an individual notice to control or eradicate noxious weeds may appeal the order in writing to the county appeal committee the decision of the appeal committee may be appealed to the district court in accordance with minn stats  1883 if the person upon whom the notice is served fails neglects or refuses to cut and remove or to cause to be cut and removed such noxious weeds within five days after receipt of such notice or if no person can be found in the city who either is or claims to be the owner of such lot or land or who either represents or claims to represent such owner the weed inspector shall cause such noxious weeds on such lot or land to be cut and removed  and the actual cost of such cutting and removal plus administrative expenses shall be certified by the city clerk to the auditor and shall thereupon become and be a lien upon the property on which such noxious weeds were located and shall be added to and become and form part of the taxes next to be assessed and levied upon such lot or land and shall bear interest at the same rate as taxes and shall be collected and enforced by the same officer and in the same manner as taxes a person charged for noxious weed control or eradication may appeal the cost of noxious weed control or eradication to the county board ii  harbor limits footnotes  2  state law reference authority to establish harbor and dock limits and to regulate the location construction and use of piers docks wharves and boat houses on navigable waters minn stats   subd 12 extent the geographical and jurisdictional limits of the city in on and over navigable waters in or adjacent to the city shall extend to the harbor limits of any adjoining municipality or other governmental unit 01 primary harbor limit the area within 300 feet of the water line on the shore of any lake or other body of water in or adjacent to the city shall be known as the primary harbor limit 02 secondary harbor limit the area extending from 300 feet of the water line on the shore of any lake or other body of water in or adjacent to the city and to the harbor limits of an adjoining municipality or other governmental unit shall be known as the secondary harbor limit 03 jurisdictional limit the harbor limits of this city shall be deemed not to extend beyond a point halfway between the shores of the body of water over which this city has jurisdiction and the shores of the body of water located in another city or governmental unit 04 secs 40354060  reserved article iii  nuisances footnotes  3  cross reference public nuisances  1631 et seq prohibited no person shall commit or maintain a public nuisance in or upon the waters of any lake or other body of water within jurisdiction of this city  nor shall any person let permit or enable any other person to use any boat dock craft or structure knowing that it is intended to be used for committing or maintaining a public nuisance no person shall willfully prevent hinder oppose or obstruct a public official in the performance of his duty in carrying out the provisions of this section or in removing or abating a public nuisance 05 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning nuisance means 1 annoying injuring or endangering annoying injuring or endangering the safety health morals comfort or repose of any considerable number of members of the public 2 interfering with or obstructing unlawfully interfering with obstructing or tending to obstruct or render dangerous for use or passage a body of water within the harbor limits of the city  for example the erection or maintenance of any dock or structure which interferes with obstructs or tends to obstruct or render dangerous for use the waters within the primary harbor limits of the city would constitute a nuisance 3 any other act or omission declared by law to be a public nuisance 06 cross reference definitions generally  12 state law reference unlawful to operate a personal watercraft in a manner that unreasonably or unnecessarily endangers life limb or property minn stats  86b313 subd 1a9  it is unlawful to operate a watercraft in a manner that obstructs or tends to obstruct normal and ordinary navigation on the waters of this state minn stats  86b311 subd 2  elements of a public nuisance minn stats  60974  permitting a public nuisance to exist upon real property under ones control constitutes a misdemeanor minn stats   secs 40634090  reserved article iv  water safety watercraft and watercraft titling failing to meet provisions of state law the failure to equip and to operate a boat vessel or watercraft in accordance with the provisions of minn stats ch 86b which is adopted by reference is incorporated in and made a part of this article as completely as if set down in full the following requirements shall be met by all owners and operators of watercraft within the harbor limits established in this chapter 1 all watercraft in use or underway between sunset and sunrise shall be equipped with and have in operation red and green running lights in the forward section of the boat and a white light at the stern or on the superstructure which white light shall be visible on a dark night with clear atmosphere for a distance of two miles from any direction motorpowered watercraft under 16 feet in overall length may use portable lights which must be clamped on the watercraft when in use  and nonpowered watercraft may use a portable single white light which is visible from any direction for a distance of two miles on a dark night with clear atmosphere state law reference lighting equipment minn rules   subp 7 2 all watercraft when at anchor or drifting must show a white light visible from any direction for a distance of one mile and such light shall be lighted from sunset to sunrise  except that a watercraft anchored in a cove within 100 feet of shore and 200 feet away from normal navigation and any watercraft anchored at a dock or pier need not have the white light lighted state law reference when underway or in use between sunset and sunrise a watercraft must carry and display the lights prescribed by the state commissioner of natural resources minn stats  86b511 3 all watercraft shall have on board and readily accessible life preservers vests or other similar buoyant devices capable of keeping every person on board afloat state law reference each person on board a personal watercraft must wear a us coast guard approved type i ii iii or v personal flotation device minn stats  86b313 subd 1a1  watercraft and duck boats using the waters of this state must be equipped with the number and type of personal flotation or lifesaving devices prescribed by the commissioner of natural resources minn stats  86b501 4 no watercraft other than an authorized water patrol boat or other police watercraft shall use or display a red light except a running red light 5 no watercraft other than an authorized water patrol boat or other police watercraft shall use or display a police sheriff or law enforcement officers flag or any device designed to simulate such a flag 6 no person shall board use damage or tamper with a watercraft except when done by the owner or with the owners consent 7 a under age 12 1 except in case of an emergency a person under age 12 may not operate or be allowed to operate a watercraft propelled by a motor with a factory rating of more than 25 horsepower unless there is present in the watercraft in addition to the operator at least one person age 21 or older who is within immediate reach of the controls of the motor for purposes of minn stats   the person age 21 or older as well as the actual operator is in physical control of the motorboat 2 a person under age 12 may not operate or be allowed to operate a watercraft propelled by a motor with a factory rating of more than 75 horsepower b age 12 to 17  permit required except as provided in this subsection a person age 12 or older and younger than age 18 may not operate a motorboat powered by a motor over 25 horsepower without possessing a valid watercraft operators permit from this state or from the operators state of residence unless there is a person age 21 or older in the motorboat who is within immediate reach of the controls of the motor for purposes of minn stats   the person age 21 or older as well as the actual operator is in physical control of the motorboat 065 state law reference authority to adopt by reference any statute code or pertinent administrative rule of the state minn stats  47162  general rules for safe operation of watercraft minn stats  86b311  restrictions on operation of watercraft by persons under 18 years of age minn stats  86b305 regulations for operation of watercraft towing persons the operation of a watercraft towing one or more persons behind the watercraft on water skis aquaplane surfboard saucer or similar device shall comply with the following regulations 1 every person being towed shall wear a life vest belt or other buoyant device except with written permission of the county sheriff or his deputy 2 not more than two persons may be towed at one time except with written permission of the county sheriff or his deputy 3 no person shall be towed by a rope cable or other towing device from onehalf hour after official sunset to sunrise state law reference operation of a watercraft towing a person on skis or any other device is prohibited from one hour after sunset to sunrise the following day minn stats  86b315 subd 2 4 no person shall be local sheriff minn rules   5 no person operating a watercraft when towing a person and no person being towed shall come within 150 feet of any bathing area skin divers warning flag swimmer or raft watercraft dock or pier except that raft dock or pier from which he is operating 6 no person shall tow or be towed at any time unless two competent persons are on board the watercraft the driver of such watercraft shall be at least 21 years of age or 12 to 17 years of age accompanied by a person at least 21 years of age who is within immediate reach of the controls of the motor and must watch where the watercraft is being driven at all times the second person on board the watercraft shall be an observer shall be at least 21 years of age shall not be the same 21yearold within immediate
